story:
THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO BACKED US! WE HAVE MOVED OUR FOUNDRAISING TO OUT WEBSITE www.materadesign.com. Please support us HERE. 

#WonderGrottole in a nutshell:

 

 

 

Short summary

 

We are passionate about small villages, we like to welcome new people to our land, and we love to concretely transform the ideas we have in our minds.

 

 

Our proposal is simple: we are seeking funding to buy two houses, renovate them, furnish them and start welcoming people from all over the world.

Our goal is € 50,000. With this funding we are buying two buildings with a total of 4 rooms: 2 double bedrooms, 2 sharing spaces: a living room / kitchen and a common laboratory area.

Support the crowdfunding campaign by booking one or more days a year at Wonder Grottole for 10 years. Having people living there is the heart of the project, to create relationships between people and the territory.

In exchange for your support we offer the opportunity to spend time in Grottole and connect with the community on a long-term basis. By contributing to Wonder Grottole, you are also contributing to revitalizing a part of the historic center of Grottole, a small village in the Basilicata region in southern Italy.

If you want to become an active part of the project, if you want to develop experimental paths and if you are part of an association, a company, a foundation, you can support the project with a contribution of € 2,000. This fee will include a special guide to the territory and the community in addition to a week in a double room for 10 years at Wonder Grottole.

///

Siamo appassionati di piccoli borghi, ci piace accogliere nuove persone nella nostra terra, amiamo trasformare concretamente le idee che abbiamo in mente.

La nostra proposta è semplice: stiamo cercando finanziamenti per comprare due case, ristrutturarle, arredarle e iniziare ad accogliere persone da tutto il mondo.

Il nostro obiettivo è € 50.000. Ciò significa comprare due edifici con in totale 4 camere: 2 camere da letto doppie, 2 spazi di condivisione: un soggiorno / cucina e una zona laboratorio comune.

 

 

Sostenete la campagna di crowdfunding prenotando uno o più giorni all'anno a Wonder Grottole per 10 anni. Avere persone che vivono lì è il cuore del progetto, per creare relazioni tra le persone e con il territorio.

In cambio del vostro supporto offriamo l'opportunità di vivere a Wonder Grottole e di incontrare e interagire con un gruppo di persone unico e interessante. Contribuendo a Wonder Grottole, state contribuendo anche a rivitalizzare una parte del centro storico di Grottole, un piccolo borgo nella regione Basilicata nel Sud Italia.

volete diventare parte attiva del progetto, se volete sviluppare dei percorsi di sperimentazione e se fate parte di un’associazione, di un’azienda, di una fondazione potrete sostenere il progetto con una quota di 2000€. Questa quota includerà oltre a una settimana in camera doppia per 10 anni a Wonder Grottole anche una guida speciale al territorio e alla comunità.

 

Wonder Grottole For You

 

Wonder Grottole offers the opportunity for you to live in an authentic historic village in Southern Italy for one day or more, in a dynamic but timeless context - by relating the local community and those coming from other parts of the world to know stories, local traditions, and explore the territory.

 

To share beautiful moments (dinners, parties, walks), and exchange ideas and experiences. To find a fertile ground in which one can experience actions (organize a party, create a clay workshop , experiment with new forms of mobility).

The houses are located in the heart of the oldest part of Grottole (“Terra Vecchia”) in the Amedeo district, and are full of stories of those who lived there until few years ago. The houses will be renovated using traditional methods and traditional materials from nature, with all the comforts of a contemporary house.

At Wonder Grottole you will find:

● An authentic historic village that wants to be explored

● Special residences renewed from buildings full of history

● A local and international community to network with

● Some moments of enjoyment (dinners, parties, walks, olive harvest)

● An immense heritage of traditions, stories, landscapes, perfumes, flavours, material culture.

A territory in which you can experience dynamic action (organizing a party, creating a clay workshop, experimenting with new forms of movement)

///

Wonder Grottole offre la possibilità a una persona di vivere per un giorno o più in un borgo storico autentico del Sud Italia in un contesto dinamico ma fuori tempo, mettendosi in relazione con la community locale del territorio e con chi verrà da altre parti del mondo, per conoscere storie, tradizioni locali, esplorare il territorio, per condividere bei momenti (delle cene, delle feste, delle camminate) scambiare idee, esperienze, trovare un terreno fertile in cui sperimentare delle azioni concrete (organizzare una festa, creare un laboratorio di terracotta, sperimentare delle nuove forme di mobilità…).

Le case si trovano nel cuore della parte più antica di Grottole (Terra Vecchia) nel Rione Amedeo, e sono piene di storie di chi le ha abitate fino a pochi anni fa. Le abitazioni saranno ristrutturate usando metodi e materiali naturali della tradizione e con tutti i comfort di una casa contemporanea.

A Wonder Grottole troverai:

● Un borgo storico autentico tutto da esplorare

● Delle residenze speciali rigenerate da edifici pieni di storie

● Una community, locale e internazionale, con cui mettersi in rete

● Dei momenti di convivialità (cene, feste, camminate, raccolta delle olive...)

● Un patrimonio immenso di tradizioni, storie, paesaggi, profumi, sapori, cultura materiale.

● Un territorio in cui sperimentare delle azioni concrete (organizzare una festa, creare un laboratorio di terracotta, sperimentare delle nuove forme di mobilità…)

 

You for Wonder Grottole

 

You can come to Wonder Grottole to stay with us, to have fun, to establish close relationships with those who live here, to create events (like a party, why not even celebrate your own birthday!), and to experience community activities (e.g. maybe opening an old wine cellar and creating a home restaurant for a day?). You can invite friends and other people to visit you!

We ask you to support us in the creation of this shared residency space that will be the starting point to bring people together, all based on the desire to switch off, being outdoors and enjoying the slow life and strong relationships that eventually will last for a lifetime.

///

Potrai venire a Wonder Grottole per stare insieme a noi, per divertirti, instaurare rapporti stretti con chi vive qui, inventarti delle cose da fare qui (tipo una festa, perché no festeggiare anche il tuo compleanno!) sperimentare delle attività da fare con la community (ad esempio aprire una vecchia cantina e creare per un giorno un home restaurant?), potrai invitare amici e altre persone a venirti a trovare!

Ti chiediamo di sostenerci per realizzare questo spazio di condivisione con residenze che creeranno il punto di partenza per aggregare persone, tutto basato sulla voglia di staccare la spina, stare all’aria aperta e godersi la vita lenta e le relazioni forti che durano, poi, una vita.

 

Basilicata

 

 

Basilicata is a land full of charm and opportunity, full of cultural and landscape contradictions, which make diversity the most fascinating element of its beauty.

Since 2013 we have travelled all over the region and we created a map with all the active people and projects in the territory. Today this map is an incredible resource that we will make available to visitors and supporters of Wonder Grottole, to create connections, networks and relationships.

///

La Basilicata è una terra piena di fascino e opportunità, piena di contraddizioni culturali e paesaggistiche, che fanno della diversità l’elemento più affascinante della sua bellezza.

Matera, Basilicata

 

Dal 2013 abbiamo viaggiato per tutto il territorio e abbiamo creato una mappa con tutte le persone e le realtà attive sul territorio, oggi questa mappatura è una risorsa incredibile che metteremo a disposizione di chi verrà a Wonder Grottole, per creare connessioni, corti circuiti e relazioni.

 

What will we do with the money?

 

Houses in Grottole are not expensive. With € 20,000 we can buy two houses, with another €20,000 we can renovate them, and with a further € 10000 we can manage the start-up phase.

If we reach our goal of € 50000, we will have enough money to have comfortable and flexible spaces to start the project. If we raise € 65000, we can buy another piece of land to create an outdoor space, for beautiful summer events.

 

We’re also hoping to have an agricultural field where dedicate ourselves to production, conversations and simply enjoy the wonderful Italian sun.

If we reach € 80000, we will buy an olive grove so we could produce olive oil for the community of Wonder Grottole.

Come on! Help us to make Wonder Grottole real!

///

Le case non sono costose a Grottole. Possiamo avere due case per € 20.000, con altri € 20.000 possiamo ristrutturarle e con 10.000€ gestiamo la fase di startup. Se raggiungiamo il nostro obiettivo di € 50.000, avremo abbastanza soldi per disporre di spazi confortevoli e flessibili per iniziare il progetto.

Se arriviamo a 65.000 €, potremmo acquistare un'ulteriore pezzo di terreno per creare uno spazio esterno da sfruttare soprattutto nella bella stagione. Inoltre sarebbe fantastico avere un campo agricolo per dedicarci alla produzione, conversare e goderci il meraviglioso sole italiano. Se raggiungiamo gli 80.000 € compreremo un uliveto così potremmo produrre l’ olio d'oliva per la comunità di Wonder Grottole.

Dai, vieni! Aiutaci a rendere Wonder Grottole reale!

 

The Impact

 

Wonder Grottole is an experiment that can generate a great positive impact on the territory, because:

- It contributes to the rehabilitation of the historic centre of the country

- It reconnects the threads of tradition and life in contact with nature, and simplicity to modern paths of life - which often too fast and needs more balance.

- It connects people who bring their knowledge and time to Wonder Grottole, for the purpose of imagining new futures with the local community, innovating existing activities, and experimenting with new human and technological relationships and housing solutions.

///

Wonder Grottole è un esperimento che può generare un gran impatto sul territorio perchè:

- Contribuisce a riabitare il centro storico del paese,

- Riconnette i fili della tradizione e della vita a contatto con la natura e con la semplicità a percorsi di vita nuovi, a velocità spesso troppo alte che cercano nuovi equilibri.

- Aggrega persone che portano i propri saperi a Wonder Grottole, il proprio tempo, per immaginare nuovi futuri con la comunità locale, per innovare le attività esistenti, per sperimentare nuove relazioni umane e tecnologiche, nuove soluzioni abitative.

 

Together We Can Do It!

 

This project brings together a large team of people. We are designers, architects, lawyers, economics experts and locals from Grottole.

All the people listed below are passionate about this project and are supporting Wonder Grottole with their time.

Andrea Paoletti - Architect and entrepreneur, he transforms spaces into unique places.

Stefano Mirti - Art Director. High school degree at Almira High School (WA, USA), University degree and PhD (technology of architecture) at Politecnico di Torino and much more. He currently works at: "999. A Collection of Questions About Contemporary Life" at the Milan Triennale.

John Thackara - Social Design Curator. John Thackara, journalist, writer and design theorist.

Neal Gorenflo - Cofounder of Shareable, expert in sharing through 10 years of entrepreneurial experience, leadership and passionate participation.

Chiara Prevete - Law designer, researcher on governance and urban management at LabGov.

Giudita Melis - Social Media and Communication Management.

///

Per lavorare a questo progetto, abbiamo riunito una grande squadra di persone. Siamo designer, architetti, avvocati, esperti di economia e persone di Grottole.

Tutte le persone elencate di seguito sono appassionate di questo progetto e stanno sostenendo con il loro tempo Wonder Grottole.

Andrea Paoletti - Architetto e imprenditore, trasforma gli spazi in luoghi unici.

Stefano Mirti - Art Director Diploma di scuola superiore presso Almira High School (WA, USA), laurea in architettura e dottorato di ricerca (tecnologia dell'architettura) presso il Politecnico di Torino e molto altro. Attualmente lavora a: "999. Una raccolta di domande sulla vita contemporanea. "Alla Triennale di Milano.

John Thackara - Social Design Curator John Thackara, giornalista, scrittore e teorico del design.

Neal Gorenflo - Cofounder of Shareable, esperto di condivisione attraverso 10 anni di imprenditorialità, attraverso la leadership e come un appassionato praticante.

Chiara Prevete - Law designer, ricercatrice di governance e gestione urbana presso LabGov.

Giudita Melis - Social Media and Communication Management.

 

Other Ways To Support Us

 

Option 1 - "Time Banking"

A stay at Wonder Grottole involves an exchange of value, not just the purchase of a travel package. It is not about passive tourism. If you cannot help by investing money, you can contribute with your time to participate in the creation and management of Wonder Grottole.

Many skills are needed to create this project: for example, community and space hosting, social communication, Wonder Grottole's visual identity development, cooking, painting, greening, organizing events and much more.

Visit our web page www.materadesign.com and fill out the "Time banking" form.

 

Option 2: Talk About #WonderGrottole

If you cannot contribute with money, share our Facebook and Instagram pages and talk about the project to those around you... This will really help us!

///

Opzione 1 - "Time banking"

Un soggiorno a Wonder Grottole comporta uno scambio di valore, non solo l'acquisto di un pacchetto di viaggio. Non si tratta di turismo passivo. Se non puoi aiutare investendo dei soldi o, in aggiunta, puoi contribuire con il tuo tempo a partecipare alle attività di realizzazione e gestione di Wonder Grottole.

Sono necessarie moltissime competenze per creare un progetto simile: ad esempio community e space hosting, social communication, sviluppo dell'identità visiva di Wonder Grottole, cucinare, dipingere, dedicarsi al verde, organizzazione eventi e molto altro.

Visita la nostra pagina web www.materadesign.com e compila il modulo "Time banking".

Opzione 2: parla di #WonderGrottole

Se non puoi contribuire con denaro, condividi le pagine (Facebook e Instagram) e parla del progetto a chi ti circonda ... Questo ci aiuterà davvero tanto!

 

FAQs

 

- What will you do with the money?

We will buy two houses, we will renovate them and start the project.

 

- What happens if we encounter a problem with the restoration of houses or will it take longer than expected?

Our project is made of a team team of professionals with a range of skills to find a solution to every problem.

 

- What happens if working with the Grottole community is difficult?

We have been working with the community since 2013 - they know us, and respect and support the project.

 

- Are supporters the owners of the houses?

No. Wonder Grottole will create an association that will own the properties. The supporters will be part of the Wonder Grottole community. In addition to living one or more days (as a reward of crowdfunding) supporters can always return to visit us at other times of the year. It is our hope that the relationship will become stronger and stronger.

 

- Who will own the houses?

The owner of the houses will be the Wonder Grottole Association.

 

- If I support the project buying one or more nights, what will happen when I get to Wonder Grottole? Who will welcome me?

Before your arrival you will be contacted to understand your expectations, information, things that you like and interests. Upon arrival there will be a host to welcome you, you will have a private double room, the use of a kitchen and a shared space. Your host will connect with the other guests of Wonder Grottole and locals. Based on your interests and level of curiosity, we will put you in touch with the territory and the community.

 

- When will everything be ready? When will we buy the houses? When will we restructure them? When will the project begin?

The crowdfunding ends in April, the purchase takes place in May, the renovation works between June and September. The opening will take place in October.

///

Cosa farete con i soldi?

Compreremo due case, le ristruttureremo e avvieremo il progetto.

 

Cosa succede se ci imbattiamo in un problema con il restauro delle case o ci vorrà più tempo del previsto?

Abbiamo coinvolto nel progetto una squadra di professionisti su varie tematiche per trovare una soluzione a ogni problema.  

 

Cosa succede se la gestione della comunità non sarà facile?

Lavoriamo con la comunità dal 2013, ci conoscono, rispettano e supportano il progetto.

 

I supporter sono proprietari delle case?

No, Wonder Grottole creerà un’ associazione che sarà proprietaria degli immobili. I supporter saranno parte della community di Wonder Grottole. Oltre a vivere uno o più giorni (come da reward del crowdfunding) potranno sempre tornare a trovarci anche in altri momenti dell’anno. Si auspica che la relazione diventi sempre più forte.

 

Chi sarà il proprietario delle case?

Il proprietario delle case sarà l’ Associazione Wonder Grottole.

 

Se sostengo il progetto comprando una o più notti cosa succederà quando arrivo a Wonder Grottole? Chi mi darà il benvenuto?

Prima del tuo arrivo sarai contattato per capire le tue aspettative, informazioni, cose che ti piacciono e interessi. All’arrivo ci sarà un host a darti il benvenuto, avrai a disposizione una camera doppia privata, l’uso di una cucina e uno spazio di condivisione. L’host sarà la persona che ti metterà in rete con gli altri ospiti di Wonder Grottole e con gli abitanti del paese. In base a interessi, curiosità ti metteremo in contatto con il territorio e la community.

 

Quando sarà tutto pronto? Quando compreremo le case? Quando le ristruttureremo? Quando il progetto comincerà?

Il crowdfunding termina in aprile, l’acquisto avviene a maggio, i lavori di ristrutturazione tra giugno e settembre. L’apertura avverrà a ottobre.

 

Wonder Grottole

"Alla Triennale di Milano.John Thackara - Social Design Curator John Thackara, giornalista, scrittore e teorico del design.Neal Gorenflo - Cofounder of Shareable, esperto di condivisione attraverso 10 anni di imprenditorialità, attraverso la leadership e come un appassionato praticante.Chiara Prevete - Law designer, ricercatrice di governance e gestione urbana presso LabGov.Giudita Melis - Social Media and Communication Management. Other Ways To Support Us Option 1 - "Time Banking"A stay at Wonder Grottole involves an exchange of value, not just the purchase of a travel package. It is not about passive tourism. If you cannot help by investing money, you can contribute with your time to participate in the creation and management of Wonder Grottole.Many skills are needed to create this project: for example, community and space hosting, social communication, Wonder Grottole's visual identity development, cooking, painting, greening, organizing events and much more.Visit our web page www.materadesign.com and fill out the "Time banking" form. Option 2: Talk About #WonderGrottoleIf you cannot contribute with money, share our Facebook and Instagram pages and talk about the project to those around you... This will really help us!///Opzione 1 - "Time banking"Un soggiorno a Wonder Grottole comporta uno scambio di valore, non solo l'acquisto di un pacchetto di viaggio. Non si tratta di turismo passivo. Se non puoi aiutare investendo dei soldi o, in aggiunta, puoi contribuire con il tuo tempo a partecipare alle attività di realizzazione e gestione di Wonder Grottole.Sono necessarie moltissime competenze per creare un progetto simile: ad esempio community e space hosting, social communication, sviluppo dell'identità visiva di Wonder Grottole, cucinare, dipingere, dedicarsi al verde, organizzazione eventi e molto altro.Visita la nostra pagina web www.materadesign.com e compila il modulo "Time banking".Opzione 2: parla di #WonderGrottoleSe non puoi contribuire con denaro, condividi le pagine (Facebook e Instagram) e parla del progetto a chi ti circonda ... Questo ci aiuterà davvero tanto! FAQs - What will you do with the money?We will buy two houses, we will renovate them and start the project. - What happens if we encounter a problem with the restoration of houses or will it take longer than expected?Our project is made of a team team of professionals with a range of skills to find a solution to every problem. - What happens if working with the Grottole community is difficult?We have been working with the community since 2013 - they know us, and respect and support the project. - Are supporters the owners of the houses?No. Wonder Grottole will create an association that will own the properties. The supporters will be part of the Wonder Grottole community. In addition to living one or more days (as a reward of crowdfunding) supporters can always return to visit us at other times of the year. It is our hope that the relationship will become stronger and stronger. - Who will own the houses?The owner of the houses will be the Wonder Grottole Association. - If I support the project buying one or more nights, what will happen when I get to Wonder Grottole? Who will welcome me?Before your arrival you will be contacted to understand your expectations, information, things that you like and interests. Upon arrival there will be a host to welcome you, you will have a private double room, the use of a kitchen and a shared space. Your host will connect with the other guests of Wonder Grottole and locals. Based on your interests and level of curiosity, we will put you in touch with the territory and the community. - When will everything be ready? When will we buy the houses? When will we restructure them? When will the project begin?The crowdfunding ends in April, the purchase takes place in May, the renovation works between June and September. The opening will take place in October.///Cosa farete con i soldi?Compreremo due case, le ristruttureremo e avvieremo il progetto. Cosa succede se ci imbattiamo in un problema con il restauro delle case o ci vorrà più tempo del previsto?Abbiamo coinvolto nel progetto una squadra di professionisti su varie tematiche per trovare una soluzione a ogni problema.   Cosa succede se la gestione della comunità non sarà facile?Lavoriamo con la comunità dal 2013, ci conoscono, rispettano e supportano il progetto. I supporter sono proprietari delle case?No, Wonder Grottole creerà un’ associazione che sarà proprietaria degli immobili. I supporter saranno parte della community di Wonder Grottole. Oltre a vivere uno o più giorni (come da reward del crowdfunding) potranno sempre tornare a trovarci anche in altri momenti dell’anno. Si auspica che la relazione diventi sempre più forte. Chi sarà il proprietario delle case?Il proprietario delle case sarà l’ Associazione Wonder Grottole. Se sostengo il progetto comprando una o più notti cosa succederà quando arrivo a Wonder Grottole? Chi mi darà il benvenuto?Prima del tuo arrivo sarai contattato per capire le tue aspettative, informazioni, cose che ti piacciono e interessi. All’arrivo ci sarà un host a darti il benvenuto, avrai a disposizione una camera doppia privata, l’uso di una cucina e uno spazio di condivisione. L’host sarà la persona che ti metterà in rete con gli altri ospiti di Wonder Grottole e con gli abitanti del paese. In base a interessi, curiosità ti metteremo in contatto con il territorio e la community. Quando sarà tutto pronto? Quando compreremo le case? Quando le ristruttureremo? Quando il progetto comincerà?Il crowdfunding termina in aprile, l’acquisto avviene a maggio, i lavori di ristrutturazione tra giugno e settembre. L’apertura avverrà a ottobre. Wonder Grottole

story:
Hi, I am Pierpaolo. I am the founder of soulShape, a social innovation initiative, aimed to safeguard the fragile indigenous cultures by creating a digital library of 3D models of traditional handcrafts.

Please, take a few minutes to get to know our work with indigenous people around the world and watch this short interview from TV show "Kilimangiaro" on RAI3 - Italian National TV.

 

The aim of this campaign is to create a new section within our digital library about traditional handcrafts of  Hadza people, some of the world’s last hunter-gatherers. Taking from the experience gain during our field missions to Mongolia, West Papua, Bolivia, and Argentina, our team is planning to travel to Tanzania in order to collect 3D models and stories of Hadza cultural objects. We expect to start this project in April 2021.

(Pierpaolo attending UNPFII at the UN building in NYC)

We chose to support Hadza people after meeting Martha - a Masai lady from Tanzania - at the United Nations Permanent Forum on Indigenous Issues in New York, where we had the chance to meet with a number of other indigenous representatives from around the world. On that occasion, Martha invited us to come to Tanzania and made us aware of the precarious condition of Hadza culture. The Hadza people a very small indigenous group (total population: less than 1000 individuals). Their communities live in the north-west area of the country, between salty Lake Eyasi and the Rift Valley highlands. Due to a hard resistance against their way of life from other groups, the ancestral culture of Hazda people is rapidly disappearing.

 

Your support

Through your help, we will finance our expedition allowing us to preserve an important part of Hazdabe culture. Hunting tools, kitchen utensils, musical instruments, dances and songs constitute the living heritage of Hadza people. Through the collection of 3d models of traditional artefacts, we will make sure that Hadza creativity is passed onto future generations.  

 

Other ways you can help us

Like our Facebook page and help us to spread the word about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to share the soulShape campaign with your family and friends.

 

Funding needs  €49.200+

In order to fully fund this expedition, we will need € 30,000. After reaching this first goal, we are going to use an additional € 19,200 to produce a documentary film that will be shared with academics, entrepreneurs, designers and the general public across the planet. We aim to inspire the creation of sustainable solutions, which are inspired to traditional wisdom and ancient designs.

Expedition: Production Equipment €9.000 (a new 3d scanner with high resolution and other additional tech material) + 3D Editing: €3,800 + Voice recording & Sound Mixing: €3.000 + Travel & Transportation: €5.000 + 3d Printing and Distribution: €2,800 + Insurance & Health: €2,300; Reach, Promote and Inspire 3,900.

Documentary: Professional Videomaker* €9,800 (filming will be assigned to NOME e COGNOME, who made the soulShape trailer in Mongolia above) + Travel & Transportation: €1,600 + Music & Sound Mixing: €3,500 + Colour Correction: €3,300; Insurance & Health: €900

* for further information about him please - we want/wish to engage the one that realized the soulShape trailer in Mongolia.

 

The soulShape's perks

(the original spoon made by Juana - Wichi people, Argentina - and 3D-printed fashion jewel made using its 3D scan file)

We would like to express our gratitude for your support with unique items and experiences ;-)  For more details about each perk, please click on the side boxs and feel free to ask any questions.

If you wish to donate one of our perks as a gift during this festive time, our team will send you a thank you email from soulShape,  which will explain to them the value of your gift. In the email, we will also ask where we to ship our perk.

1 - €29  a photo printed with Fine Art techniques on 100% cotton paper, titled "Maternity -   Datooga people", by Pierpaolo in a Datooga village in 2019.

2 - €38 "pendant - mama Wichi" 3D-printed fashion jewel from original indigenous objects from Gran Chaco, Argentina. You will be able to choose your favorite color!

3- €90 Fine-Art Limited Edition Print on 100% cotton paper, titled "Rio de la Plata" (2014), by artist-photographer Ilaria Ferretti, on the way to Wichì villages in Argentina.

4 - €99 "earrings - mama Wichi" 3D-printed fashion jewel from original indigenous objects from Gran Chaco, Argentina. You will be able to choose your favorite color!

5- €600 "Nueva Esperanza" Artwork (2014), a special Limited Edition signed by artist-photographer Ilaria Ferretti, on 100% cotton paper; in a Guarani village, Bolivia.

6- €750 box of pure organic taste delicatessen from le Marche region, Italy.

3 bottle of olive oil (500ml each)
3 jar of tomato sauce (200gr)
3 jar of jam blackberry, apple, peach&blackberry (300gr)
3 honey jar (350gr)

7- Join our Expedition: donate 5300 euro or more and take part in our expedition in Tanzania for 6 days. Volunteer as soulShaper with the Hadza community. You'll also get the  "earrings - mama Wichi" and a copy of Limited Edition Print with Fine Art techniques on 100% cotton paper, titled "Rio de la Plata" (2014).

(titled "Maternity -   Datooga people", by Pierpaolo in a Datooga village in 2019)

Team 

Founder: Pierpaolo Ceciliani (M) is a social innovator whose “indigenous business model” is based on his expertise as a Cultural Heritage and Sustainable Tourism specialist. He has over fifteen years of international experience in socio-cultural impact in tourism development (i.e. pro-poor tourism) and corporate social responsibility. Pierpaolo has worked and lived in Europe, Asia and South America. He has a strong analytical background and holds an M.A. in Tourism management (Perugia, Italy) and an international MBA (BBS – Bologna University, Italy). He is highly skilled in project management and client relationships.

COO: Luca Sabbatini is a fine art jewelry designer and an expert at using the latest 3D printing & modeling techniques, thus enabling him to make any kind of creative idea / every creator’s ideas into virtual reality. He thrives on challenges and excels at execution. His passion is working for a better world which is why his enthusiasm is infectious, generating special energy in projects that encourage the team to shine more brightly while continuing to motivate everyone with his fantastic sense of humor.

Digital Strategist: Stefano Fabbroni (M): Stefano has a degree in Communication and
Marketing at Università degli Studi di Milano-Bicocca, and he lives in Italy. He has 15 years of
experience managing communication teams in three digital marketing agencies. He has followed
international startup projects and many e-commerce projects for international brands. He worked as media and content planner and strategist for international marketing of products. He was Lecturer in Digital Analytics and Digital Trends at TSM (Trento) (2018-2019). He has excellent analytical and problem solving skills.

 

More info on soulShape 3D digital library  here:  www.soulshape.earth

story:
First and Foremost please share this wide and far! The more people know the greater chance we have of reaching our goal!

Secondly if you are a company that wishes to donate please contact us directly on info@bongalong.co.za for the best value marketing opportunity you could get in SA.

This year the goal amount of funding is way higher because we want to have marches in Cape Town, Johannesburg, Soweto and Durban all on the same day!

 

Introduction

  • Do you believe in equality for all? Are you sick of politics and economics stepping in the way of your human rights? We at Bongalong feel the same way!
  • For the past 4 years we have been the market leader in the fight for the legalization of cannabis in South Africa on the social front.
  • Bongalong has been interviewed on numerous radio stations across South Africa. We have our own production on DSTV where we ask important questions with regard to the legalization of cannabis in South Africa. We have a viewership of over 50 000 for every episode, as well as being ranked as one of the top 10 shows on Cape Town television. This should leave you with no doubt in your mind that your hard earned money will be going towards a good cause.
  • This campaign, if successful, will make it possible for us to push even harder and with greater impact,enabling us to save lives, create jobs, and ensure your human rights are not violated. Join us!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We require a ton of funding to pull off what we have in mind! Our aim is to have an organized, peaceful march taking place in three locations, on the same day, nation wide.
  • Attached is a document that sets out the budget and its requirements. This gives an indication of the amount needed in order to execute all three marches perfectly. The costs of organizing such a complex and coordinated event are very high.
  • One example is flight tickets for ‘Smokie Jo’ to travel to Durban and Johannesburg in order to have meeting with the police and to lay out the plans that that will ensure that this event is a success.
  • Your donation will make it possible for us to put together an incredible event, which will be remembered in South African history forever.
  • In addition you will receive a ranked badge to symbolise your participation in this monumental day. The badges are attached and correlate to the amount that you donate.
  • The use of funds is laid out in the documents attached on the bottom of this campaign proposal. The impact we are hoping for is to make even more people aware of this great cause and to get the general population to understand the benefits of cannabis.

These include:

  • Health benefits – cannabis has been proven to treat, and in many cases cure, diseases such as cancer, epilepsy, parkinson’s disease and many other dread diseases, too numerous to mention.
  • Economic benefits – Cannabis will be cultivated under controlled conditions, creating jobs for thousands of people and helping to relieve our current high unemployment rate.
  • Environmental benefits – Cannabis is completely biodegradable and can be used as an alternative to plastics, thus reducing harmful pollution to our rivers, oceans and landfills. In addition it can also be used in the manufacture of textiles, paper, and can even be used in the production of building materials, which will lead to cheaper housing and ‘green’ houses which are more environmentally friendly.
  • Crime reduction – If cannabis is decriminalized, it will free the police up to investigate far more serious crimes. It will also ease the plight of those trapped in the misery of unemployment. As we all well know, unemployment is a perfect breeding ground for crime. Your donation will ensure that we can move forward at a much quicker pace, thereby enabling more lives to be saved, more jobs to be created and equality for all. I believe that this project should be important to all South Africans because of the magnitude of the difference this will make in the lives of many people in our great country, from all walks of life. It will give hope to thousands of cancer sufferers as well as others with the dreaded diseases which have thus far defeated doctors, scientists and medical science.

Risks and Challenges

  • At Bongalong we believe in being open and honest. We face very real challenges on a daily basis when it comes to fighting for the cause. There is a huge push back from Big Pharma, a misinformed public, and our oh-so competent Government that seeks to delay us at every turn!
  • We firmly believe, however, that we can overcome all these obstacles if we can reach the masses through our education programme. These issues will be addressed via the social movement of which you, as a donor, will form the basis.
  • With our huge market presence, culture and community based activations we believe that if we all stand up for what is right, we will push this cause towards a fair and positive outcome. An outcome where we can save lives and uplift South Africa as a whole. So, once again we encourage you to join us!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people are not in a position to contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

• Ask folks to get the word out and raise awareness about this campaign.

• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

We ask you to share this campaign with your friends and family. Stand up and be counted for what you believe in! By sharing and spreading the word you are saving lives and uplifting SA as whole.

Join us!

 

Special thanks to:

  • Dean and Jan at little amsterdam always supporting no questions asked!
  • Kennith Anderson and Justin Pienaar for filming this and the Bongalong™ Interviews
  • Dandrej Barnard for being the greatest help a man could ask for with Bongalong and the 2016 Cannabis Walk
  • Courtney Mc Caulley for being there with a soft touch when it was needed
  • Bobd for always helping where he can
  • Ty Lopez from chronic Monkey and Bioni from MAD entertainment for always being there to help with the flyer bombing
  • Ignaz Richter for being a great help on JHB side of things
  • Penny for organising the interviews
  • Mirshin for always sending the most amazing gifts, they kept the spirits high
  • My Family for supporting me in this crazy endeavour and always believing 100%
  • Pamm Tuneraider for being MC and helping with the social media side of things
  • Son for hooking us up with some seriously important contacts
  • Blake and Danni from Knext gallery for giving us a meeting space and helping out
  • Batia Lunaris for helping with the writing and online presence
  • Chris Kaaskop for managing the marshalls, Ty you too on this one
  • Jason, Paige, Chezne and Dylan from i420 being there all the way
  • Werner Du plessis for managing and getting in some serious funding
  • Charley Coetzee for helping where ever she could even though she was working full time
  • Emlyn Emelen for taking some serious great video at the 2016 walk
  • Natichka Fourie for getting the flyers into the trance flyer packs
  • Phillip POPO for making the 2017 graphics
  • Stefan Kruger for some epic in crowd video
  • Pieter Swart for creating the Bongalong website for free
  • Rudolf schutte for standing by me since the start
  • Eddy for being my only friend that believed in this enough that he actually invested in me, even though he does not smoke anymore
  • To all my other friends that support me through this, and own my bongs, what a bunch of OG legends
  • A big thanks to the organising team of 2016 that I missed here
  • And a thanks to all those that I might have left out now, hard to remember everything when you organise a project of that size! 

This year is going to be even bigger!

Your donation will ensure that we can move forward at a much quicker pace, thereby enabling more lives to be saved, more jobs to be created and equality for all. I believe that this project should be important to all South Africans because of the magnitude of the difference this will make in the lives of many people in our great country, from all walks of life. It will give hope to thousands of cancer sufferers as well as others with the dreaded diseases which have thus far defeated doctors, scientists and medical science.
Risks and Challenges
At Bongalong we believe in being open and honest. We face very real challenges on a daily basis when it comes to fighting for the cause. There is a huge push back from Big Pharma, a misinformed public, and our oh-so competent Government that seeks to delay us at every turn!
We firmly believe, however, that we can overcome all these obstacles if we can reach the masses through our education programme. These issues will be addressed via the social movement of which you, as a donor, will form the basis.
With our huge market presence, culture and community based activations we believe that if we all stand up for what is right, we will push this cause towards a fair and positive outcome. An outcome where we can save lives and uplift South Africa as a whole. So, once again we encourage you to join us!

Stand up and be counted for what you believe in! By sharing and spreading the word you are saving lives and uplifting SA as whole.Join us! Special thanks to:
Dean and Jan at little amsterdam always supporting no questions asked!
Kennith Anderson and Justin Pienaar for filming this and the Bongalong™ Interviews

My Family for supporting me in this crazy endeavour and always believing 100%
Pamm Tuneraider for being MC and helping with the social media side of things
Son for hooking us up with some seriously important contacts
Blake and Danni from Knext gallery for giving us a meeting space and helping out
Batia Lunaris for helping with the writing and online presence
Chris Kaaskop for managing the marshalls, Ty you too on this one
Jason, Paige, Chezne and Dylan from i420 being there all the way
Werner Du plessis for managing and getting in some serious funding
Charley Coetzee for helping where ever she could even though she was working full time
Emlyn Emelen for taking some serious great video at the 2016 walk
Natichka Fourie for getting the flyers into the trance flyer packs
Phillip POPO for making the 2017 graphics
Stefan Kruger for some epic in crowd video
Pieter Swart for creating the Bongalong website for free
Rudolf schutte for standing by me since the start
Eddy for being my only friend that believed in this enough that he actually invested in me, even though he does not smoke anymore
To all my other friends that support me through this, and own my bongs, what a bunch of OG legends
A big thanks to the organising team of 2016 that I missed here
And a thanks to all those that I might have left out now, hard to remember everything when you organise a project of that size! 
This year is going to be even bigger!

story:
This is a funding campaign for 4 unique and Independently designed Catalan Independence T-Shirts

I work in Barcelona, mostly with Catalan people, and I love the passion they have for their independence. This inspired me to create a series of designs, celebrating this drive for independence.

The reason I'm making these shirts, is because I'd love to see people turn out on September 11, or on voting day, proudly wearing something that expresses their passion, and message. Having looked around for official shirts, I didn't see anything that I thought captured the passion that I felt from my co-workers and friends.

I have a quote on hold with a screen printing company, and I'm ready to put in my first order as soon as I hit the first funding goal. I'm aiming to reach the goal ASAP, as I'd love to get the shirts to people before September 11, and I've been assured by the printing company that this is possible, with the dates I've set. 

Not only that, but I will have the shirts hand delivered to anyone in the Barcelona area, just to guarantee that they get them!

The Specs on the T-Shirts are as follows -

Anvil 980 / AV105

Average Weight: 150 gsm 

Fabric: 100% Combed ringspun cotton

The shirts will be screenprinted, for the best possible quality

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need €3000. This is just to cover the cost of the printing and delivery of a minimum order of the shirts.
  • As well as the shirts, contributors will receive prints, and digital files that they can use later.

Risks & Challenges

The art for this project is already complete, and save any delays from the screen printing company (which have excellent reviews, so I'm not expecting any) I don't expect to have any issues delivering the t-shirts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Message me to let me know of any pro Catalan blogs or newspapers that might be interested in promoting the campaign.

story:
A core team of independent artists and organizers, including Manoj Kesavan, Quentin Talley, Matt Cosper and Camerin Watson, first got the idea for BOOM in 2014. Despite a minuscule budget, the first BOOM (2016) got an incredible response from the community, with coverage from every major Charlotte news outlet and an attendance of over 1,000. Since then, BOOM has grown to , over 100 performances and over 15,000 attendees annually. 

BOOM is bigger than a performing arts festival. For the past few years, the city of Charlotte has reeled from reports listing it last in the nation for economic mobility. Those born poor in this New South city are likely to never rise economically. One of BOOM’s missions is to change that through exposure to and support of the arts. BOOM Festival showcases dozens of visual, musical, theatrical and spoken word performers, more than half of the artists are people of color—fitting the demographics of the city. Not only is there proper representation, but many of the installations are interactive, encouraging all to tap into their inner creativity and become part of the artistic expression. With community support, we are changing the story of Charlotte from one of stagnation to one of incredible opportunity. Together, we are making Charlotte BOOM!

The Vision

A three-day event for attendees and artists to share an out-of-body arts experience

This includes musical performances, theatrical shows, poetry, dance, interactive installations, communal creation, and more. All ages, ethnicities, orientations and abilities take part in this together, strengthening community bonds through support of the arts.  We keep entrance accessible to all by offering much of the festival for FREE and ticketed event are only $10, with discounts when you buy a 5 Show or Weekend Pass.  We know that access to art and culture is fundamental right for all, not a privilege for a few, but in order to offer such amazing work to so many we need your help.  BOOM can't happen without your support.

story:
Why Alcohol Free?

We now stock over 125 alcohol free drinks from all over the world, but the vast majority are made here in the UK. Long gone are the days of boring, chemically tasting drinks, alcohol free drinks have burst into life. Some of the wines and beers have even won awards against alcoholic equivalents and the ever growing range of spirits are creating brand new flavours and ways to enjoy drinks booze free!

About Wise Bartender

We are a family start-up company based in the South West. Me, Tom along with my wife Bia and dad Kim have searched for the best alcohol free drinks. We want to make these drinks as accessible as possible and attend as many markets, events and festivals as possible bringing you the latest and greatest drinks to try.

What We Need & What You Get

In 2018 our purpose made bar and single gazebo did a fantastic job of introducing alcohol free drinks to around 200,000 people...but we want to go bigger with more drinks! We are trying to raise £5,000, this will purchase:

  • one 6x3m gazebo
  • four interlocking 3x3m gazebos
  • four very different custom made bars
  • Flags and Banners to promote the pop up bar

Hopefully your starting to get the picture, we want one big gazebo (the drinking area) with four smaller ones dotted around. We want to create a relaxed sociable space where you enjoy alcohol free drinks and all being well a bit sun :) 

In return we have teamed up with some great brands to thank you for your pledges this includes glasses from Pistonhead brewery, tote bags and t-shirts & bottle openers from Adnams. There is also the opportunity to be one of two annual bar sponsors :) 

But Why

We aren't on a crusade to stop people drinking alcohol, but we do want to give people choice. For many people alcohol free drinks are very new and this is a great way for them to be introduced. For others who are already fans of the drinks this is great way to try new flavours and socialise with friends.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute thats great, but no worries if not please share the campaign and tell family and friends! Hopwefully soon we will be visiting a town near you!

story:
Intro:

My name is Aryeh Capella and I'm from Colombia with a ten year experience as social activist in many areas like animal rights or peace. I was one of the activists who built a Peace Campament in the Bolivar Square after the defeat of the "Yes" option in the Colombian peace agreement referendum and now I want to make a new effort in that line.

 

Why am I doing this project?

 

Today Colombia has a final peace agreement with the FARC-EP guerilla and another peace agreement is being intended with the ELN guerilla. So, the time has come to look to the present and the future without forgetting, but without focusing in the past. Today is time to know and to recognize all the stories at the margin of History, discover the treasures and the peoples hidden behind years of war, to appreciate antagonistic ideas and ideologies, some simultaneously so close and so far away, that their existence seemed impossible.

 

SUMA-PAZ is a project that seeks to show current stories of how people do live daily in places which were only visited to emphasize war and its consequences. This project is a look at the people who construct peace every day without fuss and without expecting any reward. The SUMA-PAZ team seeks through written and audiovisual documents to show those forgotten experiences and stories that do not cross beyond a gossip or some Indy Media.

 

How will the funds be spent? 

 

In this stage we are a team of only four people, and ask for financiation for:

 

  • Costs related to research logistics in the field: stay, food and equipment insurance, in addition to rental of cameras and recording equipment.
  • Costs of production and printing of final material.
  • Legal creation expenses and minimum maintenance expenses of an umbrella NGO that will continue in the long term (at least five years) with the entire project.

 

What will happen after the funds are raised?

 


When the goal is met immediately Suma-Paz will be constituted as a permanent NGO, so that it has an umbrella organization of the project. A maximum of fifteen days after obtaining the funds, we will leave for three weeks to the first area where we will fulfill the work of documentation of stories. Ninety days after the goal we will officially present the final materials, printed and audiovisual, to fulfill our main objective. However, in case of not achieving the goal, the funds will be donated to projects that fulfill the dissemination of stories and experiences related to peace in Colombia.

 

I want to thank you a bunch for taking the time to read this and I can't wait to start this project with all of you, friends of the good colombian people.


 

Thanks from my heart,


 

Aryeh Z.B.A. Capella.

story:
USE YOUR VOICE - GIVE BACK

  • ROCKDEEP INC. is a footwear and apparel company founded by an individual who believes in giving back to the community as well as helping those who are willing to also help themselves.  His motto is always reach back and pull forward.
  • This campaign is not about raising money for our company but allowing every person who comes across this campaign to save on any and every purchase from a black owned company.
  • Ask yourself.  What other celebrity backed, or owned company is giving their supporters the opportunity to save while purchasing their items? Who's offering ownership in their companies? 

What We Need & What You Get

Details:

  • Here's where folks usually say what THEY need and what they are looking for from YOU.  We are letting you know that we are giving EVERY person who purchases a discount card a lifetime discount on all purchases from ROCKDEEP INC. 

The Impact - The Now The Future

People speak of a real life WAKANDA yet don't take the steps in contributing to that. Here's also what we plan on doing for you and those in communities around no only the United States but the world:

  • Build Technical / Transitional Centers for families who are one check away from being homeless in search of new skills and need the ability to get the assistance they need with proper dignity and support.

  • Put together youth sports travel teams to break the current AAU culture of self entitlement, adult vultures and youth understanding there is more to their future than the actual sport itself.
  • **Offering stock to a million people for $1 to give them ownership in something. We as a people need more ownership and more businesses should offer something in order to give the communities around them the ability to have ownership in something. 

USE YOUR VOICE - SHARE & SHARE SOME MORE

We can't be the society we want to be if we don't help one another and grow the entire community. As one the biggest black owned footwear and apparel company very few are aware of, we feel like its our duty to do our part.  That includes getting you to assist us in doing OUR part.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand everyone can't contribute or perhaps they simply have no need for footwear and apparel that we offer.  We want to let you know this isn't about just us and our business but challenging other's and other LARGE/MAJOR black owned businesses. 

  • So if you have Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, Tumblr, or other Social Media please share and encourage others to share.
  • If you have questions please contact us directly. info@ROCKDEEPINC.com

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Quick background 

 

Hello from Jay Freeman, Founder of Melanin Metal. Melanin Metal was founded in 2020 to help black Americans obtain fair and easy access to firearms and proper firearms instruction. One year later our organization has grown to receive its FFL license and has provided the resource of a FREE conceal carry course. 

 

The mission

 

Our campaign has a goal in mind that will create lasting effects on our communities nationwide, for years to come. The task is to fully fund the attendance and certification for 20 black men and women to become registered firearm instructors.

 

This campaign will deploy 20 different people in our communities who can teach proper and safe firearm instruction in our neighborhoods. A requirement for all candidates will be to teach at least 2 free classes per month. Our people will have the chance to obtain certificates at little to no cost, and our communities will have more knowledgeable, legal, and properly trained firearm owners. An armed society is a peaceful society. 

 

FUNDING GOAL

 

The funding goal for this campaign is $7,500.

The cost to sign up for the NRA Pistol 1 instructor course is $350. $7,500 will allow us to sponsor 21 future instructors registration fees, as well as a small gas stipend for travel. 

 

Each campaign donor will receive a $10 discount in the Melanin Metal online store. All donors will be sent signed certificates for their contributions. We hope that you put this somewhere meaningful to you, as it represents a form of your commitment to the betterment of black communities nationwide.

 

Risks & Challenges

A risk we currently face is navigating around Covid-19 and the restrictions. Most states will still offer NRA instructors courses, but both parties, candidates and the MM organization, must do their due diligence to ensure that we can get the candidate in the course. 

 

If this affects the mission in any way and no classes are available through the NRA in your area, candidates will have the opportunity to take an online course through the USCCA, and become qualified instructors as well. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

At Melanin Metal we do understand that not everyone is in the position to donate, however you can still help by : 

        •       Spreading the message 

        •       Share on other social platforms

story:
OUR PROJECT

I'm Heather Griffith, a stone mason in training right here at the City and Guilds
College in Kennington - I spend every lunch break walking through the gorgeous
park at the heart of Kennington - but I always find myself looking at the empty
granite basin at its entrance where the solid bronze Slade Urn once sat before
it was stolen... and then stolen again. 

Image: Daniel Overturf © 2016

As part of my course I've been tasked with imaging a project and thought to myself "what a perfect opportunity to give back to Kennington." 

I propose to carve a faithful replica of the original bronze urn from limestone. It will then be given into the care of the ‘Friends of Kennington Park’ on behalf of the people of this London borough as a thank you for the work they do to maintain this much loved green space in the heart of the city.

Image: The fountain as it is now and as it was upon installation in 1862.

What We Need

To recreate this urn I'll need: 

To order stone to be dug in quarry in France.

For it to be shipped to the UK.

For the stone to be put on a lathe.

For the bronze elements to be cast.

1 years tuition fees.

What You'll Get

Any contribution here will be massively appreciated and any amount given will be gifted an invitation to the unveiling. We also have some super special rewards such as two VIP tickets to The Angel Comedy Club for guaranteed entry or A bronze replica of the acorn that sits at the top of the urn. 

The Impact

By recreating this urn you'll be supporting in the restoring of some of the historical pride to one of London's oldest parks for those that enjoy the park now on a daily basis and for generation to come. 

Other Ways You Can Support the Project

I totally understand that you may not have the funds to help but there are others ways you can support. If you know anyone who you believe would be interesting in supporting the project be them: Park lovers; joggers; dog walkers; friends in Kennington; fellow stone masons or history lovers, then please share this page with them. It will be a huge help.

It will then be given into the care of the ‘Friends of Kennington Park’ on behalf of the people of this London borough as a thank you for the work they do to maintain this much loved green space in the heart of the city.Image: The fountain as it is now and as it was upon installation in 1862.What We NeedTo recreate this urn I'll need: To order stone to be dug in quarry in France.For it to be shipped to the UK.For the stone to be put on a lathe.For the bronze elements to be cast.1 years tuition fees.What You'll GetAny contribution here will be massively appreciated and any amount given will be gifted an invitation to the unveiling. We also have some super special rewards such as two VIP tickets to The Angel Comedy Club for guaranteed entry or A bronze replica of the acorn that sits at the top of the urn. The ImpactBy recreating this urn you'll be supporting in the restoring of some of the historical pride to one of London's oldest parks for those that enjoy the park now on a daily basis and for generation to come. Other Ways You Can Support the ProjectI totally understand that you may not have the funds to help but there are others ways you can support. If you know anyone who you believe would be interesting in supporting the project be them: Park lovers; joggers; dog walkers; friends in Kennington; fellow stone masons or history lovers, then please share this page with them. It will be a huge help.

story:
Short Summary

We empower nomadic communities, too often marginalized by governments and settled folks. Their know-how, traditions, relations to the environment are unique, endangered, and need to be sustained.  

As a newly established eco-tourism and the organic market, we aim to preserve the nomadic lifestyle by organizing Kooch (transhumance) tours with nomad families and sell numerous of their organic produce and handicrafts on our online store.
Our work contributes to :
- Bring supplementary income to nomad families

-Teach values of nomads' minimalist lifestyle to travelers
- Grow nomad people’s self-esteem about their lifestyle
- Reinforce the pride in their heritage
- Support the continuing of traditional customs
- Promote the role nomadic lifestyle has in the preservation of Iran's unique ecosystem

However, due to Covid19, we have been unable to conduct tours in partnership with nomad families. The online IRANomad Market started in the global Covid-19 pandemic as a solution to keep our social business alive, pursuing both the social goal of "revival of the nomadic intangible assets" and the business goal of "financial independence".  Today, your support means everything in our goal of saving Iran's indigenous people.

What We Need & What You Get

We need you to support our efforts to maintain, despite all current difficulties, our goals of supporting nomadic communities and families. To achieve this, we need :
- a committed team working
- means to develop the nomad market for sharing their productions
- communication tools and content to share the uniqueness of the nomadic lifestyle


As a sign of gratitude for your support, we will offer you unique and personal gifts.  These gifts are 100% natural and hand-made, living proofs of the traditional handicrafts and special relations with the environment of the nomads. Coming straight from nomad families, these gifts will be a special acknowledgment of your commitment.

Attention: Keep in mind that some countries have customs regulations that ban the import of dried herbs and honey from other countries (like Australia). Please look up the customs regulations in your country before getting a perk. If you purchase a perk that can't be shipped to your country, you can change the perk or have your money returned. 

  • $5:  Receive 1 digital postcard, featuring a professional photograph of one of our nomadic family partners and a short story about that family.
  • Every donation higher than $5 also receives a digital postcard.
  •  $10:  Get a voucher for a coffee/tea and a traditional afternoon snack in our Cultural House in Tehran and get to know more about nomads' customs and traditions. 
  • Every donation higher than $8 also receives a voucher for the IRANomad Cultural House.
  • $20: Donate a book with your note to the children of a nomad family.
  • $25: Get 4 small (25gram) packs of handpicked wild mountain herbs or a jar of (250gr) organic honey.
  • $35: Participate in a virtual nomadic evening, where you can hear travel stories from previous travelers who visited the nomads, view pictures and videos from the transhumance routes, and even learn some nomadic recipes.
  • $50: Receive a jar of organic honey (250gram), produced by a rare species of bees only found in Iranian mountains plus 34small (25gram) packs of handpicked wild mountain herbs gathered in the Bakhtiari mountains.
  • $75: Receive 1 small replica of the traditional nomadic black tent of Bakhtiari nomads for you and your children to assemble (picture) + a book introducing Bakhtiari nomads from a general point of view perfect for children around the age of 12.
  • $125: Receive the ingredients and recipe to make traditional nomad curd soup (Ash Kashk) including a traditional mortar and pestle to grind the curd, two-kilogram curd (Kashk), ghee, and handpicked mountain herbs.
  • $250: Get the whole set of a traditional nomadic men’s outfit including Chogha, nomadic woolen hat, and a handmade woolen bag. Chogha (a striped Bakhtiari jacket) is made from wool and it is an exclusive design for the Bakhtiari nomads. It is light & warm. You have the option to add on the women's nomadic outfit when you check out. We will contact you for the size and details. Bonus, for this donation, you will also receive the link to the virtual nomadic evening.
  • $911: Receive vouchers for an all-expenses-paid Kooch tour (Nomads' Odyssey), valid for use over the next three years. During a Kooch tour, you'll get to live with a nomadic family for 5-7 days and get a hands-on experience of their lifestyle, while accompanying them on their seasonal journey through the valleys and hills of the beautiful Zagros mountains.  Bonus, for this donation, you will also receive the link to the virtual nomadic evening.

 

 

How It All Started:

It was around three and a half years ago when we, a group of friends, went trekking with a Bakhtiari nomad family. After that, it occurred to us that we can work to stop the imminent extinction of this authentic nomadic lifestyle. So, we got the idea of creating a social business, to kindle a sense of self-esteem in the nomads in a way that they continue their precious lifestyle. In other words, they do not abandon their tents for living in cities.
Read more about us: https://nomad.tours/other/21130/a-brief-history...

Our Story During Years

So, we came up with a complementary model for rural development. The decision was made after consultation with professional anthropologists and professors. You can read their quotations in the following pictures.

 

Who Are We?

IRANomad consists of three different groups working towards the same goal which is preserving micro-cultures, empowering nomads, and rural development. These three business lines will be explained in more details in the following paragraphs:

1. IRANomad Tours

  • Environmentally and culturally sustainable tours based in Iran with a focus on nomads and nomadic culture
  •  An authentic and unfiltered, rarely-witnessed side of Iran that focuses on Iran’s indigenous people: the nomads
  • A supplementary income for nomad families in the form of tourism
  • Live like a nomad and become a part of a nomadic family: "Nomads' Odyssey" is our featured experience with the most authentic nomads of Iran: the Bakhtiari people

2. IRANomad Market

  • An online shop focused on selling organic nomadic produce such as dairy products and wild herbs
  •  Collected and provided by the nomads
  •  Selling nomadic products straight from the nomads to the customers
  • Helping the sustainability of nomadic lifestyle by providing a supplementary income
  • Bringing recognition to the nomadic families and their heritage by sharing their story with the customers in each purchase

3. IRANomad Cultural House

  • Café and hub for travel and culture-enthusiasts
  • Charming traditional house in Tehran’s oldest neighborhood
  • A place to host our nomadic friends and return the hospitality 
  • Introducing the different nomadic cultures in Iran by organizing workshops, seminars, and talks hosted by other avid travelers

How Do We Help to Preserve Nomadic Lifestyle?

In our work model, the social goal of «Preserving the Nomadic Lifestyle» is valued above all. Here are two examples in the tours and market section that showcase how we try to make each nomadic family an independent unit so that they can become financially self-sufficient even if they choose not to work with us.

1-Sustainability, small group travel, responsible visitors, respect of traditional culture: these are the main principles that we live by in our business. We also take in mind to bring travelers to different families so that no family abandons their actual nomadic life to only make money from tourism.

2-In IRANomad Market, our goal is to make nomads financially independent, in a sustainable way. We cut out all middlemen, and sell the authentic nomadic products straight from the nomads to the customers, ensuring that our nomad partners get the maximum benefit from the sales. Moreover, we tell the story of these nomadic families to every person who makes a purchase. 

Our Strengths & Challenges

Strengths:

  • We have successfully conducted eco-tours in the last three years and proved ourselves as a committed team to our travelers from all over the world (TripAdvisor comments)
  • This is our second campaign and fundraiser
  • We have an active blog with top-quality content about nomadic life, traveling to Iran, and eco-travel in the last year even when we were unable to travel and make new content to share

Challenges we face :

  •  COVID19 continuing in the next 2 years and international travel to Iran remaining suspended, thus depriving us of our main source of revenue
  • Transportation issues making it difficult to develop the internationalization of the IRANnomad Market
  • Staying alive as a company and being able to maintain our goals

Other Ways You Can Help

Now that you’ve read all our pages, we have 3 more suggestions for you: 
1- Share our campaign & be our ambassadors. You can even earn money by promoting this campaign.  Read more about our referral contest here and see how you could get a free Kooch tour or earn money while contributing to a cultural cause.

2-Follow our social media: by clicking on the following links: Facebook, Youtube, Instagram

3- Become one of IRANomad’s shareholders if you love the idea of preserving Persian nomadic heritage and believe in us as a team.  If you're interested to be an investor in our social business, check out our business plan at this link. You can buy a 0.5% or 1%  block share of our stocks.

story:
The Vision

We created an event to bring back the once famous suburb Sophiatown of the 40´s and 50´s! We want people to actively dive back into the mood of an outstanding era. We want them to experience the vibe this suburb radiated.

Through dance workshops, literature readings, and other cultural activities visitors can experience actively what Sophiatown was about. The event will peek in a concert with famous South African artists that will pay tribute to the musical legacy of Sophiatown.

Included in every ticket is a

  • guided tour with Sophiatown expert Mbali Zwane
  • a dance workshop with professional dancers teaching Township Jive and Marabi
  • a literature workshop telling Sophiatown´s story through important authors
  • a visit in a Sophiatown museum.

After the cultural activities people have time to relax with food and drinks and get ready for the show with South Africa´s famous Jazz artists:

  • Mc Coy Mrubata
  • Sibongile Khumalo
  • Sibusiso Lerole

The concert will be accompanied by a photo show with pictures of Sophiatown Photographer Jürgen Schadeberg. 

With this event we hope to evoke worldwide recognition for the rich cultural and political heritage of Sophiatown. We hope that this will become an annual event. We hope to contribute to the further development of Sophiatown and therefore educate people about the impact this suburb had on South African history.

 

The Background

“Mayibuye” translates to “come back”. Sophiatown in the 1940´s and 1950´s was rich in arts and culture. Its inhabitants had created a lifestyle that would shape African urban life and culture for ever. Though segregational issues were already on the rise in South Africa, in Sophiatown people of any skin colour and origin lived together in this neighbourhood. Sophiatown was crowded and people were rather poor, but it brimmed with rich life.

Its Shebeens (*illegal bars established in houses of so called Shebeen Queens) were the meeting point for the neighbourhood, political activists, writers, journalists, photographers, musicians and dancers. Sophiatown in the 1940´s and 1950´s became a melting pot, a unique environment where music, dance, literature, photography, language and fashion evolved as an outstanding culture and a form of political protest.

Many of South Africa´s most famous icons like Miriam Makeba, Hugh Masekela, Dolly Rathebe, Can Themba, Nat Nakasa, Jürgen Schadeberg, Dollar Brand and many more began their careers here. Nelson Mandela held one of its first outrageous speeches in the Odin Cinema in the famous Good Street, Sophiatown´s epicentre.

Jazz was the constant companion of political and cultural movements. No suprise Sophiatown was nicknamed “Little Harlem” in reference to New York´s vibrant suburb that took Jazz and African-American culture to the next level. But Sophiatown was not just a copy of Harlem. It created its own art. Jazz blent with African music to new styles like Kwela, Tsaba-Tsaba and Pennywhistle music. Swing and Jazz dances blent with African dances to Pantsula, Township Jive and Marabi.

It even created its own language, Tsotsitaal, that is still spoken until today in the townships all over South Africa. Famous photographers like Jurgen Schadeberg and Bob Gosani captured the daily life of Sophiatown, leaving an ever speaking footage for the generations yet to come. Writers like Nat Nakasa and Can Themba would become important witnesses that would leave an unexampled written documentary on what Sophiatown was like.

But as much as all those mixed cultural influences shaped its upcoming they would soon seal Sophiatown´s downfall. The Apartheid Regime who had risen to power in 1948 favoured racial segregation over anything and would establish laws to follow through with that vision. In 1955 it decided to destroy Sophiatown and remove its inhabitants to SOWETO and other townships according to their race.

They came at the break of dawn on the 9th of February 1955 and levelled Sophiatown to the ground. To mock Sophiatown´s people even more they named the left over area Triomf (Afrikaans for, well, triumph) and settled white people. Sophiatown was gone by any means. Though its artists mostly followed their careers in exile, and it was renamed Sophiatown in 2006, its cultural heritage never fully recovered from that stroke and some of it is considered to be lost and forgotten.

 

The Budget

In order to see our vision come to life we have calculated a budget in the total sum of ZAR 213.000 or € 14.760 . The Budget consists of the following:

The biggest part of the budget will go to the technical support. With the kind support of the renowned companies Gearhouse South Africa and Mushroom Productions we could already reduce the costs for Technical Support and Production Support by 60% from their normal quotations. The musical artists we want to work with also kindly agreed to reduced fees.

The costs for venue hiring will go to the Trevor Huddleston Memorial Center in Sophiatown, where the event will take place. Costs for the Photo exhibition consist of copyright fees.

This Chart might give you an even better understanding of how the budget will be spent:

 

 

The Perks

We do not just want your money, we want you to get something back. Support us by spending your money on one or more of our perks:

  • Buy a ticket to our event for an early bird offer and printed in form of a dome pass printed by famous print artists Alphabet Zoo

https://www.instagram.com/alphabet_zoo/ http://alphabetzoosa.tumblr.com/

  • Buy a meet and greet ticket and get to talk to the Artists such as Mc Coy Mrubata, Sibusiso Lerole and more who will participate in the event.

 

  • Get the latest album of McCoy Mrubata with a personal signature.

 

  • Get your own Sophiatown Art Prints. Choose between two designs or take both. Designed by visual artist Sakhile Gumbi in reference to photographs of Jürgen Schadeberg and printed by famous print artists Alphabet Zoo

https://www.instagram.com/alphabet_zoo/ http://alphabetzoosa.tumblr.com/

The print "Pennywhistlers":

 

The print "Inside Shebeen":

 

  • Get your Sophiatown bag. Designed by artist Sakhile Gumbi in reference to photographs of Jürgen Schadeberg and printed by famous print artists Alphabet Zoo

https://www.instagram.com/alphabet_zoo/ http://alphabetzoosa.tumblr.com/

 

The Team

Who is pursuing this vision? Three individuals from two different continents who share one vision.

Mtsembeni Masina (left) from South Africa, 31 years old, based in Johannesburg, worked in the arts and entertainment industry as a lighting auto technician and sound engineer for 10 years. He produces films for the past 4 years.

"I have been always highly involved within the arts. My music and literature appreciation was shaped by the golden era and generation of Sophiatown."

Dr. Kristina Kreul (center) from Germany, 34 years old, based in Berlin, worked as a lawyer and branch manager in the healthcare sector for five years. Dances Flamenco for the past nine years and Lindy Hop and Solo Jazz for one year.

"As a Lindy Hop dancer I saw Sophiatown´s history with the mindset that the Lindy Hop culture, which originated in the late 1920´s, once was lost but was brought back by some few Swedes in the 1980´s. Now it is a worldwide hopping community of roughly 60.000 dancers. I am wishing for a worldwide recognition of Sophiatown and its incredible rich cultural heritage. "

Sakhile Gumbi (right) from Swaziland, 29 years old, based in Mbabane, works as graphic designer, university lecturer and photographer. Generally gifted with creative expression, he will release his first music album soon.

"As a photographer I always was and keep on being influenced a lot by the work of Jurgen Schadeberg and Bob Gosani, photographers that captured the essence of life in Sophiatown through the camera lense."

 

The Credits

We want to thank our most important supporters so far. Without you all this would not have been and will not be possible! Siyabonga khakhulu and thank you so much!

Alphabet Zoo, Ariane Labat, Brendan and Muriel Argent, Chantal Nyandwi, Eugene Maliboho, Fruitcake Vintage, Gearhouse South Africa, Lena Soennichsen, Marie Bergdahl, Mbali Zwane, Mc Coy Mrubata, Molato Mokoena, Mojgan Derakshani, Mushroom Production, Mxolisi Mathebula, Radiant Child, Peppy Sibayoni, Sibusiso Lerole Jun., Sizwe Nhlkeo, Skhumbuzo Hadebe, Steph O´Connor, Sthembiso Mngadi, Stanley Hlwatshwayo, Thembinkosi Mavimbela, Vuyiswa Ntombela and the communities of Alexandra Township and Newtown.
