story:
The Festival

The Future Arts Foundation is expanding the Pearl Street Music & Arts Festival to A DOZEN VENUES, IN TWO CITIES, OVER FOUR DAYS! We are renaming the festival because many of the events are now expanding beyond just Pearl Street! Over the next two days, we will be hosting this fundraiser that will not only get the wheels rolling on the festival, but will support youth music and arts programs around Colorado!

Your contribution of $100 will gain you access to the opening night Gala and dinner at Rembrandt Yard Art Gallery in Boulder on April 19th, AND a ticket to the main event at the beautiful Macky Auditorium on April 21st! We promise you will not want to miss these events! Past performers include The Lumineers, Yonder Mountain String Band, The Head & The Heart, Gregory Alan Isakov, Dr Dog, Blind Pilot, Mason Jennings, and Langhorne Slim. 

Because the festival 's new main stage, Macky Auditorium, is not on Pearl Street, we are renaming the festival the FAF Music Festival. We are also going to expand the festivities and include a day of concerts and workshops in Longmont, Colorado as well as in Boulder! 

What is staying the same?

  • The feel of the festival. The festival will still be a multi-venue music and arts festival over four days with the same type of quality bands! Previous bands and musicians who have played the festival include The Lumineers, Yonder Mountain String Band, The Head & The Heart, Dr. Dog, Gregory Alan Isakov, Blind Pilot, Langhorne Slim, Mason Jennings, and more!
  • The festival is still 100% nonprofit! Proceeds from the festival benefit Colorado youth music and arts programs and supply Colorado public schools with instruments and art supplies.
  • It will rock! The festival was named one of the "Ten Most Intriguing Inaugural Music Festivals" in the World by Paste Magazine! It was also featured in the Huffington Post, Rolling Stone, Relix, the Denver Post, and more!

What is going to be different?

  • It's going to be BIGGER! The main stage is now twice the size, and the events will now take place in two cities!
  • It is going to be 100% community funded! Did you know the Future Arts Foundation has been named one of the "Five Nonprofits Making a Difference" in Colorado, and we've never taken a government grant or large corporate sponsorship?! 
  • In addition to the great national and local bands, the festival will now feature youth music and art workshops! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Because the Future Arts Foundation has never accepted a government grant or large corporate sponsorship, we depend 100% on community support! These large festivals cost tens of thousands of dollars, and fundraisers like this help supply the funding. But, we don't merely expect folks to donate. We want to give you something in return to show our appreciation! 

  • With your $100 donation, you will receive a ticket to the opening night Gala at Rembrandt Yard Art Gallery in Boulder on April 19th, 2018. This ticket will include dinner and a concert. You will also get a ticket to the headline concert at Macky Auditorium in Boulder on April 21st, 2018! This is a $200 value and is not to be missed! We cannot announce the bands yet, but just look at the others that have played this festival to get a feel (The Lumineers, Yonder Mountain String Band, The Head and The Heart, Dr Dog, Gregory Alan Isakov, Blind Pilot...)
  • You can also get signed merchandise from Jack Johnson, Widespread Panic, Wilco, The National, The Avett Brothers, and so many more! We are so fortunate to have had so many great bands donated signed memorablia to help raise funds for FAF! Please check out "Perks" for the full list.

The Opening Night Gala & Dinner

With a $100 contribution, you will receive a ticket to the opening night gala and dinner at Rembrandt Yard Art Gallery on 4/19 AND a ticket to the main event at Macky Auditorium on 4/21!

Opening Night Gala Info

  • Will take place from 6:00-8:30 on Thursday, April 19th, 2018 at Rembrandt Yard Art Gallery in Boulder, Colorado.
  • Dinner included (menu TBA).
  • Will feature live music.
  • Your name will be on the guest list at the door.
  • You will pick up your ticket for the 4/21 concert at Macky Auditorium at this event.
  • For multiple tickets, you must make multiple transactions (but there are no service fees).

And that's all there is to it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share the fundraiser on your social media pages!

And that's all there is to it.

Macky Auditorium - Headline Venue

Instrument Drop - Lafayette Elementary

www.futureartsfoundation.org

story:
Necesitamos tu apoyo para que la única librería de mujeres en Colombia tenga recursos para su funcionamiento y continúe creciendo como un espacio de encuentro cultural. Es la forma de reconocer a las autoras para las que históricamente ha sido más difícil ser reconocidas por su talento, para impulsar a las nuevas escritoras y para promover la lectura y la escritura como una manera de construir una mejor sociedad para mujeres y hombres de todas las condiciones. 

Why we're here?

I love reading and I'd always wanted to have a bookstore. I thought of it as a space where I could do what I liked the most and share my passion with other people. I have worked all my life in the struggle for equal opportunities for women, so, considering that historically for women it has been more difficult to be recognized for their talent, especially in writing, one day I made the decision to create the Bookstore of Women.

More than a dream, the Bookstore of Women is a way of asserting women authors and their role in society, and likewise, pushing new women writers. In addition, we believe that by promoting literature and reading, we can contribute to reducing the social gap that women and girls still face.

The Bookstore of Women -The Loom of Words- is a way to combat inequality and contribute to a society that is interested in art, creativity and imagination; it's a way to contribute to development and build a better society for women and men of all conditions.

I put all my capital to conceive the bookstore. The truth is it hasn't been easy. My friends, other feminist women, have contributed with their resources and have accompanied me throughout this journey, that's why the bookstore is a joint initiative.

But even though we've advanced a lot, we still don't reach the break-even point, besides we also want to continue growing. We want to have more titles available on our shelves, perform more and new cultural activities, share our learning and receive in our place more women and men who are interested in knowing, enjoying and disseminating literature written by women.

We're being honest; we reach the end of our money, but we still have all the attitude and energy to fight for this cultural and recognition of women authors’ space.

That's why we decided to do this campaign; we need support so that the only Bookstore of Women in Colombia continues to exist.

With your contribution, you will put your bid to contribute to the collective search for a solidary society, with gender equality, justice and peace; through the promotion of culture, respect and commitment to diversity and recognition of the talent of women writers, thinkers and artists.

¿Por qué estamos aquí?

Me encanta leer y siempre había querido tener una librería. La pensaba como un espacio donde podía hacer lo que más me gustaba y compartir mi pasión con otras personas.

He trabajado toda mi vida en la lucha por la igualdad de oportunidades para las mujeres, entonces, teniendo en cuenta que históricamente para las mujeres ha sido más difícil ser reconocidas por su talento, más en la escritura, un día tomé la decisión de crear la librería de mujeres.

Más que un sueño, la librería de mujeres es una manera de reivindicar a las autoras y su papel en la sociedad, y así mismo, impulsar a las nuevas escritoras. Además, creemos que al promover la literatura y la lectura, podemos aportar a disminuir la brecha social a la que mujeres y niñas se ven enfrentadas aún. Según ONU Mujeres, 15 millones de niñas en el mundo nunca aprenderán a leer ni escribir.

La Librería de Mujeres -El Telar de las Palabras- es un camino para combatir la desigualdad y aportar a una sociedad que se interese por el arte, la creatividad y la imaginación; es un camino para aportar al desarrollo y construir una mejor sociedad para mujeres y hombres de todas las condiciones.

Puse todo mi capital para concebir la librería. La verdad es que no ha sido fácil. Mis amigas, otras mujeres feministas, han aportado sus recursos y me han acompañado en toda esta travesía, por eso la librería es una apuesta conjunta.

Pero a pesar de que hemos avanzado mucho, aún no alcanzamos el punto de equilibrio, además queremos seguir creciendo. Queremos tener más títulos disponibles en nuestras estanterías, realizar más y nuevas actividades culturales, compartir nuestros aprendizajes y recibir en nuestro lugar a más mujeres y hombres a quienes les interese conocer, disfrutar y difundir la literatura escrita por mujeres.

Somos honestas; llegamos al final de nuestro dinero, pero tenemos todavía toda la actitud y la energía para luchar por este espacio cultural y de reconocimiento de las autoras.

Por eso decidimos hacer esta campaña, necesitamos apoyo para que la única Librería de Mujeres en Colombia siga existiendo.

Con su contribución, usted pondrá un granito de arena para aportar a la búsqueda colectiva de una sociedad solidaria, con igualdad de género, justicia y paz, a través del fomento de la cultura, el respeto y compromiso con la diversidad y el reconocimiento del talento de las mujeres escritoras, pensadoras y artistas.

What We Need

We have a lot of energy and all our endeavor and commitment so that the Bookstore of Women becomes a space of cultural and artistic reference for women and men.

  • In the first place, we need resources to keep the bookshop alive, while we reach the break-even point (rent, public services, cover debts acquired until now for the bookstore operation, ensure an income for the person in charge of the bookstore...). We must also do a stronger job to make the bookshop known and we need support for that.
  • It is necessary to have a larger space for the bookstore that allows us to have more books and publications, but above all where we can carry out our cultural and civic activities in an appropriate manner.
  • We want to have more titles available on our shelves. It requires money to make contracts with new publishing companies, renew the stock more frequently, buy furniture, office supplies, etc.
  • We are going to establish a permanent cultural program. We have planned workshops, exhibitions, talks, the invitation to more women authors so they can present their work, the publication of a work by the bookstore, built collectively; participation in tradeshows and events to publicize the bookstore...

We have determined some financial components that will guarantee the bookstore operation, which will be executed during a fifteen (15) months period:

  • Purchase, provision and headquarters maintenance fund
  • Project management and public attention fund
  • Cultural management fund
  • Solidarity fund

If we don't reach the goal, we will use the money to maintain the bookstore operating as long as we can, while we look for other cooperation and  collective work opportunities for it to grow.

¿Qué necesitamos?

Tenemos mucha energía y todo nuestro empeño y compromiso para que la Librería de Mujeres se convierta en un espacio de referencia cultural y artística para mujeres y hombres.

  • En primer lugar, necesitamos los recursos para mantener en pie la librería, mientras alcanzamos el punto de equilibrio (arriendo, servicios públicos, cubrir deudas adquiridas hasta ahora para el funcionamiento, asegurar un ingreso económico para la persona que maneja la librería...). También debemos hacer un trabajo más fuerte para dar a conocer la librería y requerimos apoyo para eso.
  • Es necesario contar con un espacio más grande para la librería, que nos permita tener más libros y publicaciones, pero sobre todo donde podamos llevar a cabo nuestras actividades culturales y ciudadanas de manera adecuada.
  • Queremos tener más títulos disponibles en nuestras estanterías. Se requiere dinero para hacer contratos con nuevas editoriales, renovar el stock con mayor periodicidad, comprar mobiliario y materiales de oficina, etc.
  • Vamos a establecer una programación cultural permanente. Tenemos planeados talleres, exposiciones, charlas, la invitación a más autoras para que presenten su obra, la publicación de una obra propia de la librería, construida colectivamente; participar en ferias para dar a conocer la librería...

Hemos organizado unos componentes financieros que van a garantizar el funcionamiento de la Librería, para ejecutar durante un periodo de quince (15) meses.

  • Fondo de compras, dotación y mantenimiento de la sede
  • Fondo de administración del proyecto y atención al publico
  • Fondo de gestión cultural
  • Fondo de solidaridad

Si no alcanzamos la meta, usaremos el dinero para mantener la librería operando todo el tiempo que podamos, mientras buscamos otras oportunidades de cooperación y trabajo colectivo para que crezca.

The Impact

On the one hand, in Colombia the National Reading Survey (Enlec) has found that the books consumption in the country has increased and that printed books are the format of greatest demand.

However, figures also indicate that of the total of people over 12 surveyed who say they write, only 10.9% write literature, poetry, stories or novels, and it is similar with letters or diaries; comic writing only registers 3.1%. We think that if punctual actions are not carried out to preserve reading and writing, the literature that we know, the one that has preserved our history and culture, would cease to exist.

In addition, we are aware that in Colombia there are so few actions that recognize and promote the role of arts in social transformation, especially in a country that is just giving itself the opportunity to start over, ending a conflict, trying to build peace.

In Colombia, figures from the National Administrative Department of Statistics (DANE) indicate that women have lower percentages of political participation and employment, but they are the most affected by violence.

If you, like us, believe that through promotion of culture and learning this scenario can change, your support for the bookstore of women in Colombia is crucial, as a novel alternative to fight for gender equality and a more generous society for women and girls. If women social conditions improve, the whole world will be better.

As the Colombian author Paola Guevara expressed about the women writers, the bookstore wants women to be "autonomous, empowered, aware of the power of their voice and with a very strong and well-formed criterion. Supporting each other, admiring each other, feeling sincere emotion for others triumphs; a new form of solidarity that extends to shelter the youngest ones ".

El impacto

Por un lado, en Colombia la Encuesta Nacional de Lectura (Enlec) ha encontrado que el consumo de libros en el país ha aumentado y que los libros impresos constituyen el formato de mayor demanda.

Sin embargo, estas cifras también señalan que del total de personas mayores de 12 años encuestadas que dicen escribir, solo el 10,9 % escribe literatura, poesía, cuentos o novelas, y es similar con cartas o diarios; la escritura de historietas solo registra un 3,1 %. Pensamos que, si no se realizan acciones puntuales para conservar la lectura y escritura, la literatura que conocemos, la que ha preservado nuestra historia y cultura, dejaría de existir.

Además, somos conscientes de que en Colombia son hasta ahora pocas las acciones que reconozcan y fomenten el papel de las artes en la transformación social, especialmente en un país que apenas se está dando la oportunidad de comenzar de nuevo, finalizando un conflicto, tratando de construir la paz.

En Colombia, las cifras del Departamento Administrativo Nacional de Estadística (DANE) señalan que las mujeres tienen menores porcentajes de participación política y de ocupación laboral, pero sí son las más afectadas por la violencia.

Si usted, como nosotras, cree que a través del fomento de la cultura y el aprendizaje este panorama puede cambiar, su apoyo a la librería de mujeres en Colombia es crucial, como una alternativa novedosa para luchar por la igualdad de género y una sociedad más generosa para las mujeres y las niñas. Si las condiciones sociales de las mujeres mejoran, el mundo entero será mejor.

Como la autora colombiana Paola Guevara expresó sobre las escritoras, la librería quiere que las mujeres sean “autónomas, empoderadas, conscientes del poder de su voz y con un criterio muy fuerte y bien formado. Que se apoyan entre sí, que se admiran entre sí, que sienten sincera emoción por los triunfos de las demás, una nueva forma de solidaridad que se extiende para cobijar a las más jóvenes”.

La Librería de Mujeres ya es una realidad, solo necesitamos un empujón para salir a flote.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

• Share this campaign among your contacts through your social networks (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, WhatsApp, YouTube and all other social media channels you use).

• Tell your friends, talk about the campaign in your classes, in your job, tell your family that the Bookstore of Women requires their support and why. Invite all to visit the campaign page.

• Visit the Bookstore of Women. Get to know us, make a purchase, share your experience and recommend it.

• Invite another person to make their own donation: with only one person that you got to persuade to support this cause, you will contribute in a big way.

• Help us get media appearances to promote the campaign and the bookstore, if you have contacts there.

• Follow us on our social media: Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

Otras formas de ayudar

  • Comparte esta campaña entre tus contactos a través de tus redes sociales (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, WhatsApp, YouTube y todas las demás redes que uses)
  • Cuéntale a amigos y amigas, habla de la campaña en tus clases, en tu trabajo o dile a tu familia que la Librería de Mujeres El Telar de las Palabras requiere su apoyo y porqué. Invita a todos y todas a visitar la página de la campaña.
  • Visita la Librería de Mujeres. Conócenos, haz una compra, comparte tu experiencia y recomiéndala.
  • Invita a otra persona a hacer su propia donación: con una sola persona que persuadas para apoyar esta causa aportarás en grande.
  • Ayúdanos a conseguir apariciones en medios de comunicación para promover la campaña y la librería, si tienes contactos allí.
  • Síguenos en nuestras redes sociales, en Facebook, Instagram y Twitter.

story:
TACT/The Actors Company Theatre has held a significant position in the Off Broadway Theatre movement for 25 years. Named “Company of the Year” by The Wall Street Journal, and “The Best Company in NYC” by Our Town Press, this award winning company has earned the reputation of being astute theatrical treasure-hunters unearthing and presenting amazing lost, forgotten, or underappreciated plays. Tirelessly searching libraries, estates, and even the desk drawers of famous and now departed writers, TACT’s Artistic Directors and professional resident actors have dedicated themselves to finding the old and making it new again. TACT’s mission has helped spur a movement that has spread throughout the New York theatre community, and now a quarter of a century later, there are many companies carrying the torch.

Having presented roughly 200 rarely seen plays in full productions or readings for audiences in and around New York, TACT is closing its doors, thus ending its production history.

THAT HISTORY MUST BE PRESERVED.

While we cannot preserve the ephemeral magic of performance, we can save its building blocks and records.  We need your help to see that this precious historical material is archived for future generations.   TACT materials to be saved include: dramaturgical research, photos, directors' notes, prompt books, audio recordings, cast lists and bios, original scores and sheet music, and financial records.  The TACT WEBSITE (www.tactnyc.org) alone has almost 700 pages of valuable information, dramaturgical notes, and production photos.  All of this precious history could be invaluable to future theatre-makers, academics, and theatre-lovers – to say nothing of the chronicle it represents of an amazingly lively time in the annals of Off-Broadway and New York City Theatre.

Happily, we have been honored by an invitation to house our physical archives at one of the crown jewels of NYC culture, the New York Public Library for the Performing
Arts (NYPLPA). But all of these unique documents must be scanned and digitized in order for the Library to house them in its database.  In addition, our website needs to be prepared and its future life secured.  All of this costs money.

Time is of the essence.  TACT’s fiscal year ends on June 30 and we hope to complete this and all TACT business by that date.  So we must raise this money in a very short time:  June 1 - June 15.

You can help by donating any amount.  Just use the donate button and you’ll be on your way to helping to preserve NYC Theatre history, not to mention receiving a tax deduction and one of TACT’s unique donor perks.  You’ll also be part of history as TACT will acknowledge your contribution to this project by including your name on our website for as long as it exists.  

Thank you!

CAMPAIGN BUDGET

$4,000 - Material
Archiving, digitizing, preparing and packing materials for the NYPLPA.

$3,500 - Preservation
Maintaining TACT's Website. Preparing the site for the future and updating the navigation. Securing a site custodian and the funds needed to host and maintain the site for the foreseeable future.  

$2,500 - Administrative & other costs
As we archive our history we will be also be closing down the TACT Studio where the materials are currently stored. In addition, there are some legal expenses involved in
closing our non-profit organization.

TOTAL - $10,000

story:
There are as many opinions about Israel and Palestine as there are minds and mouths (and fingers to type a tweet), but here is something everyone can agree on: People in Gaza need more books. 

Mosab Abu Toha, a young Gazan with a degree in English literature who has never been able to explore the world due to Israel’s ban on travel, escapes through reading. His friend Shadi Salem volunteered later to help with the establishment of the the library to be the only door that opened for the people of Gaza since they are suffering from many things. First, the library was in a very small place then they launched another campaign last year and they have succeeded to move to a large place. They had many activities inside and out of the library.

Noam Chomsky has donated books to the library project. Here’s what he says about it:

It has been amazing, and inspiring, to see how people surviving in the Gaza prison, subject to constant and vicious attack and living under conditions of brutal deprivation, continue to maintain their dignity and commitment to a better life. Mosab’s initiative to create a library and cultural center in Gaza is an outstanding example of these remarkable efforts. What he is seeking to achieve would make a very significant contribution to enriching the lives of Gazans and providing them with opportunities for a much better future.  It merits strong support from everyone concerned with justice and basic human rights.

If you care about Israel, Palestine, Gaza, education, reading, books, stretching the imagination through encounters with the imaginations of others, or encouraging people who are trying to make the world a better place even in extremely discouraging circumstances, please give to the project and circulate this information to your friends and lists.

 

The funds we need from January 2019 till January 2020 are:

3500 USD for renting a bigger apartment.

Two employees with a salary of 300 USD each (600 USD X 12 = 7200 USD)

A servant for deliveries and staying in the library in time of out-door activities: 100 a month (100 X 12= 1200 USD)

Operating costs (100 USD each month= 1200 USD)

More Shelves for the more books we get and tables and chairs (Estimated: 1700 USD)

 Another LCD screen 550 USD

UPS device 450 USD

Total: 15600

Mosab Abu Toha, a young Gazan with a degree in English literature who has never been able to explore the world due to Israel’s ban on travel, escapes through reading. His friend Shadi Salem volunteered later to help with the establishment of the the library to be the only door that opened for the people of Gaza since they are suffering from many things. First, the library was in a very small place then they launched another campaign last year and they have succeeded to move to a large place. They had many activities inside and out of the library.

story:
Ottawa Bad Movie Nights

Our name stands for (poor) quality

Ottawa Bad Movie Nights is dedicated to bringing together fans of cheesy, sleazy, silly, trashy, inept and wonderfully misguided cinema.

Since April 2018, OBMN has been producing A (Bad) Night at the Movies, a monthly series of FREE public screenings that is hosted by the Ottawa Public Library.

Though our partner has a licence which allows us to play many movies, so many more are not covered by it – which is why we ended up paying for ‘The Visitor’, ‘Birdemic’ and ‘Rock ‘n’ Roll High School’ out of our own pockets.

(It was 100% worth it – everyone had a fantastic time!)

 

Samurai Cop? WTH?

After seeing the audience's enthusiastic reaction to ‘Ninja III: The Domination’ at our February 2019 screening, we were convinced that its natural successor should be ‘Samurai Cop’ – an equally inept but hilarious martial arts/cop movie.

 

 

Insanity!!! Doesn't that make you want to see this bad boy?

Well, we'd just love to play it for you on February 5th, 2020.

Unfortunately, the cost involved in bringing it to our screen is well beyond what we can afford without your assistance. We need you.

‘Samurai Cop’ needs you.

 

The Samurai Cop Challenge

The cost of licensing ‘Samurai Cop’ to play it for you is 350USD. With the exchange rate and the overhead (cost of crowdfunding campaign, purchasing the movie, promotion, ...etc.), our campaign objective of 500CAD would help make it a reality.

(We'll still end up paying out of our pockets – just not as much.)

 

Samurai goodies

That’s why we’ve come up with a series of fun goodies for you! Some cost very little, far less than a regular movie ticket - this way you get something in return for helping out, on top of the satisfaction of bringing ‘Samurai Cop’ to the screen.

All of our incentives are exclusive to this campaign. We're putting together super cool-looking buttons, truly original mini-posters and even some custom “Samurai Cop” costumes to wear at the screening (and at work and family gatherings, of course).

Seriously?

Absolutely! Check them out!

(They're all limited editions, though, so grab them while you can!)

 

Samurai commitment

With your help, we believe that we can make this happen.

(After all, the “Samurai Cop” buttons alone can take us most of the way there - and they come with a puny donation of 5$ each).

But, should we come up slightly short of our objective, we here at Ottawa Bad Movie Nights commit to covering the difference.

This we promise.

We believe that ‘Samurai Cop’ is too insanely fun to pass up.

 

Samurai free-for-all

Make no mistake: the screening will remain FREE and open to all.

This will be a community event; we aren’t selling admission tickets.

But our screening of ‘Samurai Cop’ won’t happen without your help.

It just won't.

So act now!

 

No money? No problem!

Wish you could contribute to our campaign financially, but can't?

Well, you can always spread the word instead:

 

  • Tell your friends and family. Pin them down and force them to watch the 'Samurai Cop' trailer; they'll be instant converts.

 

  • Tell complete strangers. Pin them down and force them to watch the 'Samurai Cop' trailer; they'll be instant converts. (You may get arrested by a non-samurai cop, but it's a small price to pay, right?)

 

  • Spread the word on social media. Share the link to our campaign and promote it on those Facebocks, Twizzlers and Instantgrams you nutty kids are into these days.

 

  • Shout it out on every rooftop. We suggest between 6:30am and 8:30am, while people are still waking up – you'll have a captive audience.

 

Make some noise!!!

 

Finally, please hit the FOLLOW button on this page if you want to come back and donate later.

We look forward to bringing 'Samurai Cop' to you. Together, we can make it happen.

THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR HELP!!

story:
Southwest Chief Bicycle & Comedy Festival

Known as La Puerta De Colorado, Trinidad, CO is an emerging mountain town steeped in natural and architectural beauty. A traditional stop along the Santa Fe Trail, the once booming coal city has a long and colorful history. These features alone make it an ideal local to host modern day festival crowds, but what makes Trinidad so unique is it's position along Amtrak's Southwest Chief Passenger line and Interstate 25. A one-of-a-kind crossroads; sitting both halfway between the legendary comedy and improv city of Chicago, Illinois and the global film and entertainment mecca of Los Angeles, California and only a few hours drive south of the top mid-sized comedy city in the county, Denver, Colorado and a few hours north of New Mexico's thriving film and art community. There is no other place quite like it.

Wally Wallace LLC, is partnering with Bigtop Studios, Birdy Magazine and a number of businesses throughout Trinidad, Colorado and across the nation, to produce the First Annual Southwest Chief Bicycle & Comedy Festival happening Thursday May 2 – Sunday May 5, 2019 in bars, venues, and intimate spaces throughout Trinidad, Colorado's Downtown District.

This festival offers a fun and unique travel excursion for comedy enthusiasts of all ages while offering development opportunities for Trinidad and Southern Colorado. For IndieGogo supporters and ticket buyers, we offer a one-of-a-kind comedy experience, while working with local businesses to fill their hotel, bars, restaurants and stores. By doing this we are greatly supporting a small, localized economy simply by taking a vacation that offers a whole lot of laughs at a very reasonable price!

Buy Your Tickets Now and Get Them Discounted!

We have contributed the initial funds to get this festival going but are seeking sponsorship and community support (through pre-ticket sales)  to make this festival all it can be. Transportation and lodging costs have been covered, but additional funds will allow us to increase our budget for the following costs  

  • TALENT: The more tickets we have sold, the bigger our talent budget becomes! We've got some amazing connections in the national comedy community, which have afforded us the opportunity to get some incredible talent involved with this project. However, friendships don't pay the bills!  Help us raise some more funds to offer some top quality performers the compensation they deserve. 
  • Marketing: With built in partnerships with radio stations, publications, and comedy networks throughout Colorado and beyond, Southwest Chief Festivals has a wide reach for marketing. Combined with the staff's extensive experience in social media and online promotions the potential of the marketing campaign are enormous, but the addition of your financial support, we will make financial contributions to our many media partners to help spread word about the festival, and to financially support these essential local media organizations.
  • Bicycles: An essential part of this festivals is BICYCLES!  We have partnered with Rubberside Down Cyclery to bring down 10 pedicabs to transport festival attendees to transport comedians and audience members from the train station, to hotels, venues and beyond.  This service is not free though!  Help us raise the funds needed to bring these pedi-cabs (and additional bicycling resources) to Trinidad for the festival! 
  • Staffing: The Southwest Chief Bicycle & Comedy Festival has a small and dedicated staff of four individuals. They have extensive experience, and knowledge on festival and event management, but the addition of more funds for additional staff support would benefit this festival massively.

Show your support now, help us increase out budget for these costs, and get your tickets at a lower cost WITH A FREE T-SHIRT!

The Impact

Yes, the Southwest Chief Bicycle Comedy & Bicycle Festival sounds like an amazing weekend of laughs, bicycling and memories, but your support means a lot more than that. 

  • Assist in the cultural and economic development of a emerging former-mining town.
  • 25% of all profits will be donated to charity causes that support; Native American tribal organizations, GLBTQ causes, rail passenger associations, cycling initiatives, and affordable housing initiatives. 
  • Make the first Southwest Chief Bicycle & Comedy Festival a success so that we can justify making it an annual event!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk that we face as we establish the Southwest Chief Bicycle & Comedy Festival is the chance that people won't purchase tickets and/or show up for the fest!  We've put in the initial costs for transportation and housing of comedians and will throw the event regardless of expected turnout, but the success of this festival is truly dependent on your ability to become a part of it! Support our IndieGogo campaign, and get your festival pass today!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out in Colorado, New Mexico, Chicago, Los Angeles, Kansas, Oklahoma and Texas!
  • Help us with the festival as a volunteer or community partner!  For more details on that please email wally@birdymagazine.com

story:
Lake Erie Folk Fest Celebrates Five Years

This February 21-22, the Lake Erie Folk Fest will once again bring together music lovers from across Northeast Ohio for a mid-winter celebration of traditional music and dance.

The Lake Erie Folk Fest (LEFF) is a warm community gathering in the cold of winter; a celebration of diverse traditions; a gathering of musicians young and old, experienced and novice. In short, the festival inspires and fosters traditional music in Northeast Ohio.

Passing It On

The Lake Erie Folk Fest is dedicated to ensuring that traditional music and dance is passed on to newcomers and to new generations. To accomplish this, the festival offers:

  • a school program for area students
  • an amazing array of free music workshops, jams, dances and performances
  • an affordable evening concert
  • and this year, master classes for intermediate to advanced bluegrass musicians

We Need Your Support

LEFF depends on donations, large and small, from generous individuals such as yourself.  Dollars raised from this campaign represents just a portion of festival costs, the largest of which is artists fees.

Please consider a donation and be sure to join us for the 2020 festival!

  • Friday, Feb. 21, 2020 -- morning school program
  • Friday, Feb. 21, 2020 – bluegrass master classes
  • Saturday, Feb. 22, 2020 -- afternoon workshops and evening concert

More Things You Can Do to Help

  • Spread the word and talk it up!
  • Share this campaign, LEFF's website, and Facebook, Twitter and Instagram pages
  • Ask your friends and family to make a donation
  • Ask your employer to become a sponsor
  • Volunteer your services before or during the festival... this is an event by and for the people!

Contact Us

Visit our website at lakeeriefolkfest.com or email us at lakeeriefolkfest@gmail.com.

story:
TranszFeszt Budapest 2019. március 29-31

Magyarország, és valószínűleg az egész régió első transz tematikájú fesztiválja 2014-ben került megrendezésre. Majdnem öt évet kellett várnunk rá, hogy újra megszervezhessük.

Reményeink szerint hagyományteremtő módon a Transznemű láthatóság nemzetközi napja köré időzítettük az eseményt, idén március 31-én zárul a fesztivál.  

Egyik fő célunk, hogy felhívjuk a figyelmet azokra a kérdésekre melyek transz, nem-bináris illetve dzsender-nonkonform emberekként foglalkoztatnak minket ma Magyarországon. Különösen fontos számunkra, hogy teret biztosítsunk transz vezetők és művészek számára.

Az országban, és a közösségünkben tapasztalható rossz anyagi körülményeket figyelembe véve szeretnénk a fesztivált a lehető leginkluzívabbá tenni azzal is, hogy minden esemény ingyenes lesz.

Támogasd a szervezőket, hogy a magyar transz közösség méltó módon ünnepelhessen!

Mire kell a pénz?

Ahhoz, hogy a megnyitó, a filmvetítések, a beszélgetések, a kiállítások és a közösségi programok megvalósulhassanak abban a formában, ahogy megálmodtuk szükségünk van a segítségedre.

Az adományokat terembérlésre, útiköltségre, programfüzetre és a megnyitó egyéb költségeire fordítjuk.

Milyen kihívásokkal nézünk szembe?

Ingyenes eseményként a fesztivált teljes mértékben nagylelkű adományozók és olyan támogatók teszik lehetővé akik a közösségünket növekedni és erősödni szeretnék látni. 
Az adományod ahhoz járul hozzá, hogy többféle programot valósíthassunk meg még hatákonyabban.

Hogyan segíthetsz még?

Tudjuk, hogy nem tud mindenki anyagilag hozzájárulni, de másképp is segíthetsz! Nem tudsz most pénzt adományozni, de így is terjesztheted a kampány hírét. Oszd meg Facebookon vagy Twitteren. Küldd el a barátaidnak akiket érdekelhet a linket. Itt Indiegogon is ott vannak az ikonok ehhez!

Kövess minket: facebook.com/TranszFeszt
Weboldal: transvanilla.hu/transzfeszt

Önkénteskednél?
Szerveznél?
Előadnál?
Írnál rólunk?
Lépj velünk kapcsolatba: szervezet@transvanilla.hu

Köszönjük szépen a támogatásod, az idődet és az elkötelezettséged!
A TranszFeszt szervezői csapata

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TransFest Budapest 29-31 March 2019

Hungary's first ever trans-themed festival, and possibly the first one in the region was organised in 2014. We had to wait almost five years to have the opportunity to organise the next one.

We hope to set a tradition organising the festival marking the Trans Day of Visibility, this year the closing day will be on 31 March marking TDOV.

One of our main goals is bringing awareness about the issues that as trans,  non-binary and gender nonconforming people we face in our everyday lives in Hungary. It is also our priority to give voice to transgender leaders and artists.

Given the grave economic situation in our country we want to make the participation in the festival as inclusive as possible  and all events will be free of charge.

Support the organisers to let the Hungarian trans community celebrate.

What we need the money for? 

To organise the opening ceremony, the screenings, the discussions, the exhibitions and the community events as we dreamed, we need your help.

All donations will be spent on room rental, program booklet cost, travel cost and other costs related to the opening.

What are the challenges?

As a free event, the festival is run completely on a basis of generous donations and support of people who wish to see our community continuing to grow and form tighter bonds.

Your donation helps us to organise the diverse events we planed and allow us organising programs otherwise we could not.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can make a financial contribution, but there are other ways you can help! 

If you are not able to donate at the moment you can still help by getting the word out about our campaign. Post this link on Facebook. Tweet about it. Send it directly to friends and contacts you think might love this idea. You can use the share tools right here on Indiegogo! 

Like us: facebook.com/TranszFeszt
Website: transvanilla.hu/transzfeszt

Want to volunteer?
Want to organise? 
Want to perform? 
Want to write about us? 
Please e-mail us: szervezet@transvanilla.hu

We thank you greatly for your support, time and engagement!
TranszFeszt Organizing Team

Ingyenes eseményként a fesztivált teljes mértékben nagylelkű adományozók és olyan támogatók teszik lehetővé akik a közösségünket növekedni és erősödni szeretnék látni. Az adományod ahhoz járul hozzá, hogy többféle programot valósíthassunk meg még hatákonyabban.
Hogyan segíthetsz még?
Tudjuk, hogy nem tud mindenki anyagilag hozzájárulni, de másképp is segíthetsz! Nem tudsz most pénzt adományozni, de így is terjesztheted a kampány hírét. Oszd meg Facebookon vagy Twitteren. Küldd el a barátaidnak akiket érdekelhet a linket. Itt Indiegogon is ott vannak az ikonok ehhez!
Kövess minket: facebook.com/TranszFesztWeboldal: transvanilla.hu/transzfesztÖnkénteskednél?Szerveznél?Előadnál?Írnál rólunk?Lépj velünk kapcsolatba: szervezet@transvanilla.huKöszönjük szépen a támogatásod, az idődet és az elkötelezettséged!A TranszFeszt szervezői csapata
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
TransFest Budapest 29-31 March 2019
Hungary's first ever trans-themed festival, and possibly the first one in the region was organised in 2014. We had to wait almost five years to have the opportunity to organise the next one.
We hope to set a tradition organising the festival marking the Trans Day of Visibility, this year the closing day will be on 31 March marking TDOV.
One of our main goals is bringing awareness about the issues that as trans,  non-binary and gender nonconforming people we face in our everyday lives in Hungary. It is also our priority to give voice to transgender leaders and artists.
Given the grave economic situation in our country we want to make the participation in the festival as inclusive as possible  and all events will be free of charge.
Support the organisers to let the Hungarian trans community celebrate.
What we need the money for? 
To organise the opening ceremony, the screenings, the discussions, the exhibitions and the community events as we dreamed, we need your help.
All donations will be spent on room rental, program booklet cost, travel cost and other costs related to the opening.
What are the challenges?

As a free event, the festival is run completely on a basis of generous donations and support of people who wish to see our community continuing to grow and form tighter bonds.
Your donation helps us to organise the diverse events we planed and allow us organising programs otherwise we could not.
Other Ways You Can HelpWe know not everyone can make a financial contribution, but there are other ways you can help! 
If you are not able to donate at the moment you can still help by getting the word out about our campaign. Post this link on Facebook. Tweet about it. Send it directly to friends and contacts you think might love this idea. You can use the share tools right here on Indiegogo! 
Like us: facebook.com/TranszFesztWebsite: transvanilla.hu/transzfeszt
Want to volunteer?Want to organise? Want to perform? Want to write about us? Please e-mail us: szervezet@transvanilla.hu
We thank you greatly for your support, time and engagement!TranszFeszt Organizing Team

story:
What is Juicebox

Juicebox is a variety of intimate femxle events focused on promoting self love, liberation, exploration, empowerment, education and creating a compassionate community.  Watch the video above for more info! Events are multifold and in the past have included yoni gazing, cabin get-aways, 6-course dinner parties and creative workshops on self love. Our members include people who identify as: female, transgender and non-binary. We do not discriminate against color, body shape or how many wrinkles one has, we appreciate that everyone is different and is uniquely beautiful. We are based in Norway, but see the demand for these events and community throughout the world so we plan to expand across borders within 5 years. 

Right now we are asking for your help to take Juicebox to the next level with creating this event and community application. Our goal with Juicebox is to empower womxn and create a better community for us all. 

 

The Juicebox App

Why an app? Because todays facebook group algorthims makes it very hard for us to reach out to our members. The goal with this app (and website) is to make it easier to find future events, buy tickets, find information about juicebox, testimonials and education. However our main focus with is app is to build a community platform including profiles and chat forms in order to connect with each other in a safe space with like minded people. 

In the making of this App we are supporting a small female dominated app developer agency in Bergen by the name Svippin. The cost of creating this app is 400 000,- NOK (+ 12 000 Idiegogo fees) and will take up to four months to create. The start date for development is 22nd of Feburary 2021, all contributions exceeding the crowdfunding goal will be used to develop free and cheaper events for  our members. In the case we unfortunately do not achieve the crowdfunding goal we have a few back-up plans to make sure the development of the app prevails, however the more help we get the easier it is for us to achieve our ambition, that is why every donation counts.

Please consider making a donation today and know that the entirety of your generous gift will empower femxls to be themselves, grow their self-esteem, become more equal and create a society that is more open, compassionate and has stronger cohesion.

It is possible to donate whatever amount you feel like -> Look for the pink button "BACK IT".  Thank you! 

 

Want to learn more about Juicebox? 

Current facebook group -> https://www.facebook.com/groups/776004332589379

Instagram -> https://www.instagram.com/juicebox_oslo/

 

Check out our media coverage here (all are in norwegain): 

Articles

Universitas: https://universitas.no/sak/65580/sofia-27-arran...

Aftenposten: https://www.dropbox.com/s/zhzu8r3jj637uhh/A-mag...

Podcasts

Nrk EKKO (1:24:00): https://radio.nrk.no/serie/ekko/sesong/202002/M...

Sykt ærlig med Martine: https://open.spotify.com/episode/5ZNrlMAblQwWMb... 

Klimaks: https://www.nettavisen.no/podkast/serie/klimaks...

Documentary 

Insider Fem s03e01: https://www.discoveryplus.no/programmer/insider...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute today, you can still help our cause by sharing this project with friends and feminist who wish to make a difference. Use the Indiegogo share tools above to share and post this campaign on your social media!

Thank you for taking the time to read, and contribute to our project. We look forward to connecting online and in person with every single one of you in the near future.

Thank you!

Juicebox Team

story:
Where we are

I was working on my PhD in Biochemistry & Biophysics when I started #BLACKandSTEM, which showed the need for community for Black STEM students, educators, and professionals in an unprecedented way - reflected by our recognition in outlets such as Fast Company, NPR, and B*tch Magazine. With almost 6 years of continued work to support the #BLACKandSTEM community (that has grown into the thousands) and that includes advocacy at the federal level, I look to our supporters for help.

For the past 6 years, I have used my own funds and time to keep the community going, and there is more that I want to do. To expand available resources, I am looking to complete business registration and trademarking and continue revamping of our website.

What we need

I am starting the campaign with a goal of raising $1000 to support business registration and trademarking including legal fees. Funds raised in excess of the costs of registration and trademarking will be prioritized toward paying for website registration and hosting.

If we do not reach our goal, all funds will go toward supporting business registration and trademarking.

#BLACKandSTEM's impact...

Has been demonstrated time and again over the years. We work with several organizations in demanding diversity, equity, and inclusion that is effective and felt by those historically marginalized in education and STEM areas. From individualized assistance in areas of professional development to ensuring that the needs of minoritized groups are embeded in policy, #BLACKandSTEM is committed to it's community and beyond.

story:
Second Amendment History

One of our interests is the History of Firearms in the U.S.A., another is Building Online Projects

Our plan with this project includes:

  • Continued Research and Presentation the Gun Laws & their History in the USA
  • Outline, Compare and Interview the Gun Owners Rights Groups 
  • Interview Key Players in the 2A Community
  • Archive & Publish the Results

It's about time..

Your support will:

  • Give us time to build 2A History projects
  • Cover server fees, resources, equipment, etc
  • The more we raise, the more elaborate 2A projects we can create

Our Goal

We continue to build an archive of information on United States 2A History:

  • The history of our US Gun Laws
  • Build easy to find 2A Fact Lists
  • Available for all (Research, Education)
  • We hope this info might inspire & assist other 2A creators 

Stretch Goals

This campaign is all about time, so here is how we will use that time

  • $556 = We get to work
  • $1,000 = We do more 2A Activist Interviews
  • $2,500 = Gun Rights Policy Conference / AmmCon Efforts
  • $5,000 = New Equipment - Software, Laptop, 360 Camera
  • $7,500 = Animated 2A History Cartoons
  • $10,000 = Upgrade Vehicle for 2020 Tour
  • $20,000+ = Towards 2020 Gun Show Loophole Tour

Past Projects

We work toward our 2A Goals with Community Building, 2A Websites & Social Media: GunStreamer, InstaGram, You Tube Channel, etc
But we have not created the ultimate 2A Resource... yet

This Project

This time around, we will focus on the history of:

  • Getting Ready for Gun Rights Policy Conference, AmmCon & 2020
  • Building 2A Media Community
  • History of Firearms Laws
  • History of Gun Owners Rights Groups
  • Interviews of 2A Activists

 

Risks & Challenges

This project has very little risk. 
We will be building the archive no matter how much (or how little) we raise in this campaign
The more the campaign raises, the more time we can spend on this project and the more elaborate it can be

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but you can still help:

  • Please help get the word out
  • Make some noise about this campaign.
  • Make a GunStreamer.com - GunTube.org or You Tube Video
  • Please use the IndieGoGo share tools for Facebook & Twitter

Thank You !!

story:
Short Summary

Today (October 18th) is Church Clarity’s two-year-old birthday. And for our birthday, we launched this Indiegogo Campaign to ask our supporters to make a financial contribution to finish building a new website which will allow us to keep publishing churches! 

Church Clarity is a crowdsourced, volunteer-verified database that scores local church congregations for how clearly they communicate their actively enforced policies on their websites. We're currently focused on policies that impact LGBTQ+ and Women in Leadership. You might know us from our hashtag #ClarityisReasonable on Twitter, but if not, we're excited to share more about our unique mission. We're not here to try and change policies or theologies -- or correct your favorite bible scholar about the greek. 

Instead, our simple goal is to establish a consistent standard of clarity for church policy disclosure. We encourage slash demand that churches make their policies clear online in order to reduce the harm caused by bait-and-switch rhetoric that often masks actual policies.

Since we launched two years ago, we have grown beyond expectations. Some stats:

  • Our volunteer team now consists of 159 people globally
  • 5,000+ churches have been submitted to our database.
  • 500+ churches have voluntarily submitted polices & are scored Verified Clear™
  • We've published close to 3,000 churches.
  • Our backlog is miles long and continues to grow!

 

We’ve also published blog-posts and stories challenging some of the largest churches in the world who claim tens of thousands of congregants. We have put church authorities on notice and shifted the terms of conversation in the church world. Perhaps most critically, we’ve  become a go-to resource for anyone looking for a church that simply aligns with their values. 

Now at the ripe age of 24 months, our rapid growth has broken our website. Sort of. Our website host (Webflow) can only handle about 100 more records (i.e. churches) published on the platform and despite appeals to increase our capacity and efforts to restructure our data to reduce the load: it's clear that we can't scale further with our current configuration. So, after much internal discussion, we’ve concluded that our best solution is to build a new website and reboot with adequate infrastructure. But we need your help!

Do any of these statements apply to you? 

  • I've found a church through Church Clarity
  • I've helped someone find a Church through Church Clarity
  • I've worked at a church. People have found us through Church Clarity
  • I've become more informed about a church’s policies through Church Clarity
  • i've gained fresh insight  about the church-world through Church Clarity 
  • I'm interested in seeing this work accelerate & improve.

 

If so, keep reading for deets on how you can participate!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $50,000 to build a new website in 3 months. 
  • You’ll get perks: shoutouts, merch discounts, a CC FastPast, etc!
  • The satisfaction of investing in a worthwhile initiative with a track record of results.
  • A new and improved ChurchClarity.org - better search, cleaner interface, faster publish times, more content a bigger and increasingly reliable database. 

 

If We Fall Short of Our Goal:

  • We'll continue to be scrappy and manage our growth in smaller increments. 
  • Just super duper slowly 
  • Our search feature will keep being not amazing. 

  • Significant delay to our timeline (6-9 months)

 

The Impact

Your contribution will accelerate the completion of our new website by several months. This means we can quickly resume publishing new churches to our database, and will give us a better response to the very patient emails we've been receiving with inquires as to why so-and-so church is not yet online (the patience has seriously been incredible)! 

It’s time to act our age (albeit, still an infant) and fully replace our immature technical infrastructure. 

You can continue submitting churches to us (churchclarity.org/crowdsource) and they will go into our scoring pipeline, and we’ll get them published as soon our new website is built! 

Every day, people find churches in their neighborhoods through Church Clarity. We want to continue to be a resource for church-seekers, for journalists, as well as a reliable source of people-powered accountability for megachurches that obscure their actively enforced policies. Any funds we raise above our goal will go towards further enhancing our website as well as investing into more content creation such as a podcast and more blog posts as well as enhancing efforts to sustain our model through Church Clarity Membership. 

To date, Church Clarity has been almost entirely self-funded. We've paid vendors and hosting fees out of pocket, including occasionally incentivizing volunteers for their labor. And we’ve done a lot with a little: Churches go through three rigorous levels of review by our remote volunteer team, who have collectively spent an estimated 3,500 hours (or 145 days) (!!!) to processes church website submissions. However, software development is a skill for which there is much demand and little supply. In order for us to build the website within the next 3 months, we need an infusion of capital. We want to score every church in America and equip people with the information they need to decide where to invest their time and money.

 

Risks & Challenges

Ultimately, we’ve demonstrated our ability to bootstrap and operate with more volume than we initially anticipated (V1 of Church Clarity was built as a SquareSpace blog, lol). With these capacity limitations comes the need to scale up much quicker than we had originally planned. This means that the next iteration of our website must result in a more sustainable model that is less labor-intensive, more efficient for our volunteers and that delivers a better experience for the end user. These are all challenges we are well prepared and equipped to tackle. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out by sharing our campaign on social media -- or just text it to three people whom you know have benefited from Church Clarity. 
  • Make a contribution directly at churchclarity.org/contribute
  • Get your church to become Verified Clear! 
  • If your church is already Verified Clear, encourage them to become Church Clarity Members or consider offering to sponsor the cost of their membership!
  • You can keep submitting churches to us through churchclarity.org/crowdsource
  • Join us as a volunteer and get trained on how to review and score church submissions: churchclarity.com/vc-individual

 

Thanks for your support! Check out the details of the campaign, hit us up on Twitter or email and let us know what questions you have. #ClarityisReasonable!

story:
Let's make Magical happen! 17-20 August 2018 in a beautiful location in West Sussex.

We are Team Magical: Zoë, Yoshi, Yello, Hannah & Adam, and we think life is totally AMAZING! Each and every person you meet has wonderfully unique qualities, and everyone has something valuable to contribute to the world.

But society is not set up to help you believe this or fulfil your true potential. 'They' basically tell you that you're not good enough as you are, and need to buy stuff to make you happy! We think… NO! You are already the mutt’s nuts!

That’s why we’ve set up Magical - a small, boutique festival where you can be the BEST you, free from the pressures of modern society that hold you back. A place to embrace your weirdness and celebrate your quirkiness! To us, being yourself is literally the most important thing in the world, and in our opinion is the only route to true happiness, fulfilment, ridiculousness and joy! It’s literally where the magic happens!

We ran a pilot festival in 2016 with the intention to inspire guests to be the best versions of themselves; to be social, creative and celebrate life. The feedback was incredible - everyone danced like there was no tomorrow, and most importantly we helped people get a little bit closer to their true selves and to each other. Bingo! It worked!

Now we want to bring Magical to the public, so everyone can experience our life-changing event. With a 1,000 person capacity, Magical 2018 will be bigger, better and even more beautiful... but WE NEED YOUR HELP to make it happen!

Even more important than your financial support, we need you to bring your positivity and open mind to the festival.  This contribution is priceless!


 

We’re raising £30,000 to get this amazing project off the ground, which is around 50% of the cost to run the event. As you can see, it costs quite a few pennies to run a festival!

This would be enough to get the ball rolling for Magical 2018, putting down deposits for the infrastructure such as:

  • Our beautiful venue in Sussex
  • The main stage and additional tents
  • Boring behind-the-scenes stuff like generators and fencing
  • All the essentials, such as toilets & showers (posh ones, obvs!)

And of course booking all the things that make Magical special:

  • Bands & DJs to make you dance your socks off!
  • A plethora of inspirational speakers & interactive workshops
  • Decorations and lighting that will make the place sparkle!

We’ve provisionally booked some top class artists, so The Correspondents, Plump DJs and Carnival Collective (+ more!) will be playing at Magical 2018 if the crowdfunding target is met!

WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DON'T REACH OUR TARGET?
If we don't reach the £30,000 goal by the deadline, THE FESTIVAL WON'T HAPPEN. This opportunity to do so much good will be lost and your money will be returned to you in full.

But imagine if we DO reach our target. You’ll be responsible for making the world a bit more magical by helping to launch this festival! Join the community - back the project today.
 

 

BOUTIQUE VOUCHERS
If the crowdfunding target is met, boutique camping will be available to book in early 2018. We’re offering crowdfunding backers special packages with Boutique Vouchers that give you £100 discount on a lovely Bell Tent! Note: only 1 voucher can be used per bell tent.
 

LOCATION: A beautiful site in Sussex (near Haywards Heath, 1 hour south of London)

DATE: 17-20 August 2018

TICKETS: Full weekend adult ticket (inc standard camping) = £120 full price
-----> SAVE £40 by purchasing your ticket on this campaign! Only £80

CHILDREN: Magical is family friendly! Full weekend child ticket = £60 full price
-----> SAVE £20 by purchasing a child ticket on this campaign! Only £40

BOUTIQUE CAMPING: Available to book in early 2018 with luxury Bell Tents (up to 6 people)
-----> Bagsie your Boutique Voucher to receive £100 discount on your bell tent booking

LINEUP: The Correspondents, Plump DJs, Carnival Collective and many more amazing acts!

OUR AIM: 1,000 people being their true selves through workshops, crazy dancing and one-of-a-kind experiences. We can create an inspiring event, but it’s YOU that will make it AMAZING! The question is... will you be there? Get your ticket TODAY and we can make this happen!


 

As well as snapping up perks, there are several other ways you can support the project!

  • Help us to spread the word about the campaign, by using the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Follow us on Facebook and Instagram, and share our posts and events.
  • Keep in touch by signing up to the Magical Mailing list.
  • If you are coming to Magical 2018… bring your friends! They will have an amazing time, and you’ll get the kudos for introducing them to Magical!
 

  • Website: www.magicalfestival.co.uk
  • Facebook: www.fb.com/festivalmagical
  • Instagram: www.instagram.com/magicalfestival

 

Team Magical would like to give our extra special super duper thanks to the following superstars, who have given (and continue to give!) their time, energy, enthusiasm and love to help make Magical happen.  You are truly amazing people!!!

  • Everyone who came to (or volunteered at) Magical 2016 and made it one of the most special weekends EVER!
  • All who pledge on this campaign - you really are making a difference in the world!
  • Richard Jackson for the video editing: www.richardjacksonvideo.co.uk
  • Edward Taylor for the video footage: www.digital-flow.co.uk
  • Jody Kirton for the drone footage: www.phlexproductions.com
  • Launch Party Managers: Marina Popova, Bob Westerman, Reza Ghaniloo, Jody Kirton
  • Launch Party Crew & Contributors: Abbie, Azure, Chunky, Dan, Dave, Edie, Fairy-Lou, Ian, Jackson, Jess, Kat, Mary, Messy, Mikey, Morgan, Myles, Nick, Ollie, Pete, Piers, Sean, Simon C, Simon D, Tom and Waynie

All our love!!!

Zoë, Yoshi, Yello, Hannah & Adam

story:
（日本語は一番下に記載しております）

Japan Festival Boston

Japan Festival Boston has three simple goals- to introduce Japanese festival culture, to foster and encourage a sense of community between Japanese and American communities in the Boston Area, and to show gratitude and love towards the city of Boston.

Our sincere hope is that Japan Festival Boston will grow and be recognized not only by our local communities, but internationally as well. Not everyone has the chance to visit and experience a Matsuri in Japan, but that doesn’t have to stop anyone from experiencing our culture. We cannot achieve this goal without your help. Please join our crowdfunding campaign and contribute whatever you can to help keep this tradition alive for future generations, and to create a festival our children and grandchildren can call a “Jimoto no matsuri”, or “hometown festival”.  Your generous donation will help support the cost of our festival.

Japan Festival Boston 2018 will be held in Apr 28 and 29 in Boston Common.

Official Website: www.japanfestivalboston.org/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JapanFestivalBoston/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/JapanFestBoston

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/japanfestivalboston/

The Japanese Business Bureau of Boston (JBBB) who is sponsoring this event is 501(c)3 Not for Profit Organization. All donations are tax-exempt and 100% tax-deductible. All donations will be used in running the event. If you have questions or concerns, please contact us at "info@japanfestivalboston.org". A financial statement will be published after the event.

 

How Can You Get items?

You can get items in exchange for the e-mail confirmation of your order.

At "Information booth C" in Japan Festival Boston in Boston Common.

Only in April 29, 2018. (Festival will be held also in April 28, but you can exchange only in April 29)

 

What Can You Get?

 

 

Provided by Sodateru Towel（http://sodaterutowel.com/english）

(http://www.japanfestivalboston.org/sponsor-spot...)

 

 

Provided by Snappy Kitchen (http://snappysushi.com/), Ganko Ittetsu Ramen (http://www.gankoramen.com/), Ebisuya (http://ebisuyamarket.com/index-en.php#.WMn-kRLhAmo), Yume-Wo-Katare (http://www.yumewokatare.com/)

 

Provided by Yome-Wo-Katare（http://www.yumewokatare.com/）

 

Provided by Yume-Wo-Katare (http://www.yumewokatare.com/)

 

JAPAN FESTIVAL BOSTON

このボストン日本祭りはボランティアの力だけで成り立っている全米最大規模の日本祭りです。

ボストンで暮らす日本人として世界に、そしてボストンに

感謝を込め、コミュニティーを一つにしてこの祭りを行っています。

この祭りに来れば日本文化を学ぶことが出来、日本人を理解することができる。

文化を理解し合う事から世界の平和が生まれると私たちは信じています。

私たちは100年続く日本祭りを目指しています。

 

ボストンにいる日本人だけではなく、世界の日本人の方々のご協力があれば

日本の文化を後の世代につなげる事ができます。

 

人種に関わらず、世界の皆さんのご協力が頂ければ、

この祭りはきっと世界の平和への一歩を担ってくれると思います。

 

どうぞ皆さん、一緒にこのボストン日本祭りを一緒に作り上げてください。

 

100年続くよう、どうぞ日本祭りにご協力をお願いいたします！

Official Website: www.japanfestivalboston.org/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JapanFestivalBoston/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/JapanFestBoston

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/japanfestivalboston/

主催のThe Japanese Business Bureau of Boston (JBBB) は米国政府認定の非営利団体です。ご献金は全て免税対象になります。また、頂いた寄付は全て公園警備，ゴミ処理などの実際の費用に費やされます。収支報告は祭り開催後にホームページ( http://japanfestivalboston.org）上に公開されます。

なお、クレジットカードによる日本からの寄付も可能です。日本のクレジットカードですとBilling addressのzip codeは00000でも通ることが多いです。

story:
Milestone Architecture PLLC is collaborating with Pratt in Venice and is co-curating the exhibit with Patriarcato di Venezia. Our firm is a dynamic, young, global architectural and design practice, based in New York and with representatives in India, Italy, and Turkey. Our mission statement expresses our firm’s spirit and dedication.

Milestone’s mission is to create environmentally conscious architectural design that meets the needs and enhances the lives of people around the world. At the same time, we strive to preserve the timeless legacy of architecture and design through the restoration of classical and historical buildings.

In the spirit of the planners of Venice, our project, Dimensions: Two Venetian Scole, aims to utilize cutting edge architectural survey technology in an effort to conserve the current state of vital landmarks in the city’s built environment. Using 3D laser-scanning, extremely accurate images of the structures including Scola de Cristo & Scola dei Merchant, will be captured, refined and made public.

 

By doing so, we will elaborate the historical aspects of the artworks and structures, as well as aim to reconstruct the original artworks and functions present in the buildings. In addition, we will exhibit contemporary digital art (which is shown here in our video) in the historic structure as a reminder of the timeless and fluid nature of culture. 

The project also acts as means of giving agency to the local population to catalyze future conservation and artistic projects at their discretion.

 

 

Venetian culture, heretofore, has been nearly invisible within the significant cultural event of the Venice Biennale. If the Venetian community is enabled to participate as a constituent, rather than as spectator, in the Venice Biennale of Architecture 2018, it would give visibility to the tremendous efforts of the Venetian community to save besieged Venetian culture. There are architectural and structural challenges confronting the scole sites that are inherent to the well-documented risks imperiling Venice, including lack of financial resources, competing interests, fractured governance, native depopulation, and environmental hazards.

In 2014, Milestone Architecture PLLC worked on Torcello, an island in the Venetian lagoon, drawing attention to its importance as a global heritage site. We recently published a book, entitled Restoration Initiative: Torcello-Venezia, Italia, about Torcello's history and our architectural survey process. Using 3D digital laser-scanning technology, we were able to report extremely accurate images of the structures, including the seventh-century Basilica of Santa Maria Assunta, the twelfth-century Martyrium of Santa Fosca and the Campanile.

A key feature of our Torcello project was its "human-centered design", its accessibility for youth, the elderly, and the disabled. Working with an accomplished team of researchers, we developed methods for elevating the tactile nature of exhibit elements, in order to increase the way in which we could inform and educate exhibit visitor.

  • Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word. Share our cause with your friends and colleagues!

Visit the exhibition website : https://dimension-twovenetianscole.org/

story:
Summary

The creation of a book that explores the thoughts and experiences of some of the Puerto Rican kids who triumphed over one of the world’s most vicious natural disasters.

The work

#1

Work directly with the youth of Puerto Rico to create an account of life before, during and after Hurricane Maria through the eyes of a child.  Writing workshops will be held at select locations on The Island 1x per month for six months. A qualified Social Worker will be at each workshop to help the youth cope with some of the strong feelings they may have.

#2

A publisher is in place who has already agreed to publish the finished work and allproceeds from the book will go towards select youth organizations in Puerto Rico.

#3

The books will be made available free of charge to all of the youth of Puerto Rico.

#4

This book will be an innocent and honest interpretation of their fear, pain, loss, anger, hopelessness and ultimately triumph. It will serve as a release valve for both, the youth who participate and those who read it. 

#5

Through this project we hope to introduce these beautiful children to the writer in their hearts, so they may continue to tell their stories. 

The Facilitator

The workshops will be conducted by award winning writer/director/producer Felix Rojas. Rojas has written for both the stage and screen. His Play GROWING UP GONZALES recently toured Puerto Rico where he received his inspiration for this project. Gonzales will be touring the world in both English and Spanish. Rojas’ other credits include Papi’s Promise, Soy Chris, El Conde Y La Condesa, Hotel Presidential, Cielito Lindo, A Place For Us and Diego Dies just to name a few. Rojas believes that writers have a responsibility to lure the human soul to a better place. With our gift we should look to not just write but to inject a small drop of humanity into the hardened veins of our modern society. More information on Rojas can be found at www.papispromise.com

The Plan

THE PROJECT WILL BEGIN AS SOON AS ALL OF THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS ARE IN PLACE.

TRANSPORTATION SPONSORS – $3500 - $4500

CAR RENTAL SPONSORS – $3800 $4200

LODGING SPONSORS – $3400 - $4800

PUBLISHER – EDIT/PUBLISH/REPRODUCE

STAFFING/DEVELOPMENT/COORDINATION/IMPLEMENTATION SPONSORS –$22,000

The proposal is straight forward. It is a project that stands alone but has all of the elements to branch out into something bigger and greater than anyone can imagine. I invite you to partner with me in this very special project. As a sponsor you will be helping a generation heal from an event that very few adults let alone children can resolve. You will also receive a signed book and a group picture of all of the participants. Your names or company names will be displayed prominently on the first page of the book.

His Play GROWING UP GONZALES recently toured Puerto Rico where he received his inspiration for this project. Gonzales will be touring the world in both English and Spanish. Rojas’ other credits include Papi’s Promise, Soy Chris, El Conde Y La Condesa, Hotel Presidential, Cielito Lindo, A Place For Us and Diego Dies just to name a few. Rojas believes that writers have a responsibility to lure the human soul to a better place. With our gift we should look to not just write but to inject a small drop of humanity into the hardened veins of our modern society. More information on Rojas can be found at www.papispromise.com
The Plan
THE PROJECT WILL BEGIN AS SOON AS ALL OF THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS ARE IN PLACE.
TRANSPORTATION SPONSORS – $3500 - $4500
CAR RENTAL SPONSORS – $3800 $4200
LODGING SPONSORS – $3400 - $4800
PUBLISHER – EDIT/PUBLISH/REPRODUCE
STAFFING/DEVELOPMENT/COORDINATION/IMPLEMENTATION SPONSORS –$22,000
The proposal is straight forward. It is a project that stands alone but has all of the elements to branch out into something bigger and greater than anyone can imagine. I invite you to partner with me in this very special project. As a sponsor you will be helping a generation heal from an event that very few adults let alone children can resolve. You will also receive a signed book and a group picture of all of the participants. Your names or company names will be displayed prominently on the first page of the book.

story:
Studio Current is Seattle’s artist run culture creating subterranean laboratory located in the heart of the Pike/Pine corridor of the Capitol Hill neighborhood - and yes darlings - we are headed into the fifth year in our current incarnation! So many of you have been a big part of this journey coming to shows and workshops, as artists in residence, as volunteers, as performers, rehearsing, creating, and living something of the art life within our walls. Thank you. It’s literally what we’re here for and it’s such an honor to provide the kind of support you let us know you need. 

SC is volunteer run by a group of queer artists who believe in the mission: to support participation in the arts. We are:

Laura Aschoff - director of internal operations

Angelina Baldoz - director of communications

Renee Shure - media manager

Markeith Wiley - director of development and productions

Katherine Cohen - artistic director

Part of why we’re fundraising is with the hope that we can start paying these fine folks for their efforts! Everything else goes toward bills and rent.

We’re a micro organization operating on a shoestring budget but we’ve grown into a hub for experimental and underground arts. The services Studio Current provides are in high demand. But as SC grows, the workload on our volunteer directors does too, and we’ve hit a point where our funding doesn’t match the energy output and expenses needed to meet the demands of our community utilizing the space. 

So, we need to raise this money to keep going another year. The good news is:

We have a unique opportunity thanks to a few generous supporters to quadruple every dollar donated to this campaign. 

That’s right, for every one dollar donated by you here SC will receive $4. It’s super powerful amplification and this gift couldn’t have come at a better time.

That means if (((you))) can help us reach the goal of 10K here, Studio Current can continue through all of 2020! 

So, one more time because this is amazing: 

You donate $20.

It gets quadrupled.

You’ve made it possible for SC to receive $80 with your $20 donation

And there are some cute offerings of gratitude for your support here: tiny videos, stickers, pencils, tshirts, festival and series passes, and maybe a few pop ups along the way.

If we don’t reach the 10K goal here we’ll keep going & exploring the options as long as we have the resources to do so.  SC directors have gotten really good at making things stretch and filling in the gaps ourselves, but we’re at a make or break point. 

More artists                            across different       communities

               and working                                      in different                    modalities

are using                   the space                                 than ever before           

                                                                   WE SERVE

Our local community of art lovers: with events that are more often than not either free or suggested donation and always no one turned away for lack of funds. Over 60 public events in 2019 means SC has averaged 5 events a month, from self produced short run shows to one off events, our monthly art walk event JUICY, the SC Sessions variety show, the music series Loud A/F + Dreamy A/F, Glory Hole, Intima Cabaret, and the annual all day/ all night art festival F***YES! /OH! F***

Our local community of artists: that otherwise would not have the access and opportunities to long term and affordable artist residencies, rehearsals, and events. Our rates are the lowest in town.

 Low cost, high impact support: for self produced DIY shows. SC offers space, technical support, marketing support, and event staff for you to bring your vision to life in our studio.

As a hub in Seattle’s arts ecology: especially for queer, experimental, and underground art. 

Access to art events, access to space and support for artists, and a priority of support for experimentation is what SC is all about. The energy here is amazing and it’s absolutely because of the way artists can and do use the space, and how audiences are invited to be here. We’d love to keep it going another year and it looks like we have a fighting chance for 2020!

***If you can donate money - great! There may have never been a better time to do it at any dollar amount!! It’s so incredibly helpful and appreciated!

Another way to help out is to have an event and donate the proceeds to this campaign!

OR! Sock it to us with a shoutout! Share this link if you find us worthy - every bit of amplification helps! Grassroots as heck but proudly powered by Shunpike - tiny and legit!

Thank you, wonderful community.
